job_summary:
Date: 02-Sep-2022 
      







Location: Sydney, NSW, AU, 2000 
      







Employment Type: Permanent Full Time 
      








The Role
As a DevOps Engineer, you will be responsible for maintaining the MLC online platform components deployed into AWS. This includes the tooling and pipelines used to provision environments as well as the environments themselves.


The DevOps Engineer will create and manage the development systems, structure, tools, and resources that support our infrastructure and assets as well as support their ongoing function ensuring teams are able to develop at pace. Occasional administration tasks such as environment patching and re-provisioning, as well as the creation of supporting tools and assets such as certificates is a core part of the role.


The successful applicant will have a strong interest in automating repetitive tasks and a willingness to learn new skills and technologies as the platform develops, with a view to making the development experience of our team a positive one.


Key Responsibilities:

Work with our software engineers to design, automate, deploy, monitor and continuously improve all our environments, tools, and processes
Help maintain source code management, continuous test, and deployment services for our engineering department
Monitor and optimise our environments and where possible cost optimisation
To provide guidance to junior team members & developers
Collaborate with the team to improve engineering tools, systems and procedures
Automate and streamline as much as possible
Improve our build scripts and enhance our pipelines
Certificate management


 
To Be Successful in This Role You Will Possess:

2+ years relevant experience.
Postgraduate qualifications appropriate to the technical level.
Exposure to Java Development.
Comfortable with Linux systems administration.
Experience building and maintaining cloud infrastructure with a focus on web applications.
Professional experience on operating Amazon AWS Cloud (EC2, VPC, VPN, EBS, S3, Route53, IAM, AWS CLI etc).
Exposure to automation of AWS resource creation using CloudFormation/Terraform templates.
Experience with continuous delivery environments like Jenkins or TeamCity.
Comfortable with Bash, Python, and Ansible.
Experience with Docker/Containers and an understanding of SSL Certificates would be beneficial.



Benefits

In return, we offer development opportunities at an ASX top 200 company
A professional, supportive, and friendly culture
A range of corporate and lifestyle benefits


 
The Business
IOOF is one of Australia’s largest financial services companies and we offer a full range of products and services, including financial advice, platform management and administration, investment management and trustee services. The IOOF Group has been helping Australians secure their future since 1846. During that time, we have grown substantially to become a leading provider of quality financial services. We now manage and administer more than $200 billion of client monies and are listed on the Australian Securities Exchange in the ASX top 200 (ASX:IFL).


To Apply


Applicants will be required to provide evidence of their eligibility to work in Australia, and at a minimum be required to undertake police and basic credit checks as a condition of employment.


Please note that applications from agencies will not be considered at this time.


IOOF is an inclusive and equal opportunity employer. We encourage applications regardless of race, ethnicity, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need assistance or an adjustment during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request.


Given IOOF is currently undergoing an Organisational Design process, please be aware that it is anticipated that organisational change will occur.

Sydney

 
Before “fintech” was a thing, our founders were dreaming up new ways to transform banking, simplifying the customer journey and the employee experience.
More than 26+ years later Sandstone Technology is still leading the charge, innovating and evolving as the industry evolves. Our high client retention rate is our proudest achievement with 40 financial institutions across Australia, New Zealand, Asia and the United Kingdom placing their trust in our solutions.
From digital banking and digital onboarding to origination and AI-based data analysis, with cloud-based or on-premise deployment, we create flexible, robust, end-to-end solutions using a multi-channel approach that gets our clients to market faster.
At Sandstone, our people are our number one asset and we believe in providing opportunities for our people to develop and grow their careers through our training and development programs, mentoring and on the job coaching. Our employees enjoy a healthy work life balance with a number of social activities planned throughout the year, to relax and celebrate successes!

 
The Role
Sandstone Technology is a leading Australian Fintech and provider of award-winning digital origination, banking, and lending automation solutions.
We are seeking a highly technical individual to join the Platform Operations squad, within our Sandstone Platform Services division.

 
Key Responsibilities include:

Provide regular internal stakeholder updates
Maintain up to date documentation
Ensure operational efficiency, reliability and security of the SCS Platform
Become a DevOps advocate to our clients and help realise efficiency benefits for Sandstone
Conduct analysis and review of identified technology processes and provide recommendations for improvement
Provide operations support for hosted products as part of the Cloud services offering
Drive operational efficiencies through automation of repetitive tasks
Available for 24/7 on-call roster on rotation.



About you

1-2 years of experience in a DevOps, Systems Engineering or Software Developer role
Understanding of software development lifecycle
Experience with a programming language
Experience in production critical environments
Understanding of security best-practices
Experience working with AWS (or Azure/GCP)
Good understanding of TCP/IP Networking concepts
Enthusiastic learner, who enjoys keeping abreast of industry developments
Energetic and highly outcome focused
Exposure to Ansible, Terraform, Cloud Formation and/or Kubernetes, Docker, Packer, Git is advantageous but not essential
Experience with scripting languages such as Python and/or BASH is advantageous but not essential




Why Sandstone?

Career development planning and opportunities to achieve certifications such as SAFe, AWS
WFH allowance
Access to training resources and allocated time off for additional training of your choice
Flexibility and work/life balance



 If you like the sound of this challenge and you are interested in working with us, apply now with your CV!

job_summary:
Orygen Digital Melbourne Contract 
   1/9/2022 


Parkville location | Close to tram, train and onsite parking
Full time 12-month position available | 1.0FTE
Flexible working arrangements available


   Your new job
   
 The Senior Devops Engineer drives the innovation of the infrastructure behind MOST and takes ownership of the infrastructure roadmap. They are responsible for the performance, availability, security and cost of application services at an operational level – from supporting internal development activities through to production.
   
 Reporting to the Head of Engineering, Orygen Digital you will:
   

Work on the continued development of the Moderated Online Social Therapy digital mental health web platform.
Drive innovative leadership, with general direction and collaboration from Head of Engineering, to owning and implementing the DevOps roadmap, ensuring alignment with other team leads and broader strategic Engineering goals.
Assist in determining the decisions made by the development team.
Provision, integrate and maintain AWS services and technology integration
What you’ll need
   
 You are passionate, energetic and determined to make a difference to health and wellbeing outcomes for young people. The following criteria must be met for consideration for this position:
   

Significant commercial development experience and Proven experience in commercial Devops.
Proficiency with the AWS ecosystem – ECS, IAM, EC2, RDS, Route53, Lightsail, API Gateway, Cloudformation.
Proficiency with development environments and CI/CD automation.
Proficiency and experience of security considerations, implementation and best practices.
Ability to problem solve and exercise high level judgement when performing development activities and where issues require escalation.
What you’ll get in return
   

Salary package between $120,000-$140,000 commensurate with skills and experience + 10.5% super + NFP salary packaging up to $15,900.
Ability to purchase additional leave; access to EAP; generous Parental Leave Scheme.
Flexible work to suit your lifestyle and access to policies and tools that support this
Orygen – leading the revolution
   
 Imagine a future with unlimited potential. A future where every young person enjoys optimal mental health as they grow into adulthood. At Orygen, this is our life’s work, because we passionately believe it’s what all young people deserve.
   
 Every step of the way, young people and families are at the heart of everything we do. Always. Through world-leading research that creates change. Through pioneering reform that delivers real-world practical solutions.
   
 At Orygen, that’s the future we’re creating right now. To do it, we have revolution in mind.
   
 Join the revolution
   
 If you’re keen to join Orygen and be part of our team challenging the status quo and reshaping the future for young people, apply now.
   
 For more information and to review the position description, please follow the link
    https://www.orygen.org.au/getmedia/733031d5-d6d1-48bf-bbe0-8a0cfaf1fb60/Orygen-Digital-Position-Description-Senior-DevOps-Engineer-072022.pdf.aspx
   
 This is a full time 12-month contract. 
   
 Applications will close on 29th September 2022, unless a suitable candidate is found sooner.
   
 Orygen is dedicated to gender equality, diversity and inclusivity. We strive to continue to build a culturally safe workplace where our values underpin the way we work and our commitment to First Nations people of Australia, young people and their families, LGBTIQA+ people and CALD people. We strongly encourage applications from the First Nations people.

Our company partners with clients in business, finance and government to provide the unrivaled insights and perspectives that lead to well-informed, confident decisions. We call this The New Intelligence. IHS Markit serves more than 50,000 key customers in more than 140 countries, including 80 percent of the Fortune Global 500. We help decision makers apply higher-level thinking to daily tasks and strategic issues across a host of industries and disciplines including energy, finance, automotive, engineering, technology, maritime and trade, aerospace and defense, chemical, and economics and country risk.

 We offer you an excellent opportunity to: 

Develop and maintains mission-critical financial services systems.

 About You

Excellent oral and written communication skills with a keen sense of customer service. 
Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills. 
Process-oriented with great documentation skills. 
Knowledge of best practices and IT operations in an always-up, always-available service. 


What we offer 

The salary levels paid in the company are competitive and attractive in relation to the market 
There is a generous package of conditions that includes benefits such as: financing a gym, comprehensive health insurance, participation in the company's options program (traded on the stock exchange) and more ... 
We are flexible when it comes to combining work from home and office and in any case, we believe in a healthy balance between the two 
The work environment in the beautifully designed offices in Israel combined with the charming staff, make our company a wonderful place to belong to

Excellent opportunity for DevOps Engineer with significant experience in AWS and cloud technology stack to support the strategic direction of one our leading client within Fintech space. This role is a permanent full time role, based in Melbourne CBD (WFH)
 As a DevOps Engineer, you will work with the development team to manage the build, release and operational support processes critical to supporting the applications.
 Your role and responsibilities will be:

 Develop solutions across build engineering, cloud migrations, containerisation and configuration management practices
 Responsible for Continuous integration (CI) and Continuous Delivery (CD) process implementation
 Perform branching, tagging, release activities on version control tools
 Perform and deploy builds for various environments like QA, Integration, UAT and production environments
 Work with containerisation tooling and orchestration across different
 Ensure all components are built to provide quality, security, scalability, stability, efficiency and reliability


 Required Experience:


 Strong DevOps experience within an IT enterprise environment that is comprised of AWS and on-prem systems.
 Scripting language preferably Powershell, Go, Bash or Python.
 In depth knowledge and experience with containerisation and associated tooling such as Docker and Kubernetes, ECS, EKS, etc.
 Experience in continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD), environment automation, release automation, virtualisation, infra as a code and metrics tracking.

 Build and deploy experience on platforms such as Buildkite, Jenkins, Travis CI, Bamboo, GitLab, TeamCity, Artifactory, Nexus etc.
 Working with or implementing of monitoring and logging solutions like ELK, Splunk, AppDynamics, Sumo Logic, New Relic etc.

Brisbane or Melbourne -Be part of high performing team with a great team culture
We invest time in our people and help them chart their own career trajectory

 Based in Brisbane or Melbourne, the 
 DevOps Test Engineer has three primary objectives:
 

Provide consulting advice into specific squads to assist with the creation of automated test suites for their microservice capabilities
Create an organisation testing strategy and help squads implement that strategy through tooling, documentation and examples
Develop and publish metrics that measure the progress of the testing strategy
Delivery of these objectives will be aligned with both our organisational culture as well as the delivery of Shell Energy’s strategic initiatives.
 
 Your time will be split between working with squads to support their test automation progress, while also progressively building out components to meet common needs based on your assessment of (and feedback from) the application squads. The percentage of your time allotted to these activities may fluctuate over a longer period. You will exemplify self-organising behaviours, a continuous improvement mindset and an inclusive one-team culture. As part of everything you do, you will apply Test Automation, CI/CD, Site Reliability Engineering and new Application Architectures (specifically Microservice Architectures and Event Driven Application Architectures).
 

About you:

 The role requires an experienced full stack software engineer with the technical and personal skills to create strategic technical change across an organisation. You will have demonstrated experience in mentoring / training / consulting and driving change through others.
 
 To be successful you will need experience driving adoption of test automation practices across an organisation and the technical skill and experience to back this up. Given Shell Energy’s technical direction and current solutions, the incumbent must have experience across several development languages, with a particular focus on .
 NET, Javascript / Typescript and Python. Additionally, experience working in an 
 AWS environment will be advantageous. The successful applicant will embrace our DevOps model and be in alignment with our ‘It starts with why’ culture.
 

Why join us?

 At Shell Energy we work in a culture of care and curiosity, and encourage innovation and collaboration. We support flexible working and embrace a diverse and inclusive environment, with people who are passionate about disrupting the industry and simplifying energy for our customers. Guided by our three core values – respect, integrity and honesty – we focus relentlessly on delivering outstanding service and cutting-edge solutions to our customers. We do this by employing the best people in the business, and empowering them to get on and do what they do best.
 

About Shell Energy

 Shell Energy is Shell’s renewables and energy solutions business in Australia, helping its customers to decarbonise and reduce their environmental footprint.
 
 Shell Energy delivers business energy solutions and innovation across a portfolio of electricity, gas, environmental products and energy productivity for commercial and industrial customers, while our residential energy retailing business Powershop, acquired in 2022, serves more than 185,000 households and small business customers in Australia.
 
 As the second largest electricity provider to commercial and industrial businesses in Australia, Shell Energy offers integrated solutions and market-leading customer satisfaction, built on industry expertise and personalised relationships. The company’s generation assets include 662 megawatts of gas-fired peaking power stations in Western Australia and Queensland, supporting the transition to renewables, and the 120 megawatt Gangarri solar energy development in Queensland.
 
 Shell Energy Australia Pty Ltd and its subsidiaries trade as Shell Energy, while Powershop Australia Pty Ltd trades as Powershop. Further information about Shell Energy and our operations can be found on our website. https://shellenergy.com.au
 

Recruitment Agencies please note: this recruitment assignment is being managed directly by the Shell Energy Human Resources team. We will reach out to our preferred agency partners if required. Your respect for this process is appreciated.

Overview
This role responsible for designing and implementing DevOps solutions including CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure as code, monitoring and observability solutions, and automation across both hardware and software offerings. Using their domain expertise this individual will work with the team to increase quality and reduce friction in software engineering with the aim to shorten the software and systems development life cycle and provide continuous delivery with high software quality.
A bit about us
mIoT is an Australian manufacturer of award-winning IoT devices and a developer of transformative IoT software. We enable enterprises to reach for better, through the advanced digitization of traditional processes and networks.This connection of the physical and digital worlds through our hardware and software impacts on the responsible extraction of resources in mining, sustainable food production in agriculture, efficient movement of resources across our transport networks, and improved resilience in our water and energy networks.
We are looking for a Senior DevOps Engineer to join our team based in Australia.
The opportunity
This role responsible for designing and implementing DevOps solutions including CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure as code, monitoring and observability solutions, and automation across both hardware and software offerings. Using their domain expertise this individual will work with the team to increase quality and reduce friction in software engineering with the aim to shorten the software and systems development life cycle and provide continuous delivery with high software quality.
Essential Job Functions;
Develop deployment automation for infrastructure and application releasesFoster technical excellence and DevOps culture, with the adoption of CI/CD principals within the development team and throughout the businessSupport defining branching strategies for the source code appropriate for the teamPromote deployment automation strategies such as feature flags and blue/green deploymentsThe benefits
Be part of a team of customer obsessed innovators that build amazing products, helping to make the world a better, safer, and more sustainable place.
We love new tech as much as you do and want to make sure you have all the tools and equipment you need. Innovation and continuous improvement are in our DNA. We’re always striving to be better and do better which ensures you’ll always be up to date with any training you may need for today and the future.
We’re agile and move quick like a start-up, yet we have the structure and support of something much larger thanks to being a part of the Madison Group. This means we’re able to offer some benefits that traditional start-ups simply can’t. Such as lunch every day prepared by our in-house cook or additional days of annual leave each year.
mIoT is for everyone, so come as you are. We’re open humans who champion a culture of diversity, belonging and respect.
Want to be a part of our future? We’d love to hear from you! Applications must include a resume and cover letter to help us get to know you better and understand how you would add value to this opportunity and the team to be considered.
What we are looking for
At mIoT we are passionate about making an impact and we are looking for someone who also believes that the ability to connect millions of people and things, across our vast country and the world, is exciting and brings about endless opportunities
To be successful in this role, you will have
Demonstrated experience in creating pipelines for cloud-based solutions specifically in a hyper scaler cloud environment such as Azure and AWS.Comfortable with PowerShell or Bash scripting languages.Programming experience within C# or Python languages.Experience with Infrastructure as Code ( Either Terraform, Azure Bicep or Cloud Formation )Experience integrating applications with monitoring and observability solutions like Application Insights or other equivalent services.Experience using Docker and containerizing applications.Experience using Azure DevOps, Jira and Git.Critical thinking and problem-solving skills.Good written and verbal communication skills.
In addition to your skills and background we are seeking someone to live and breathe our Madison Group Values; Connect, Embrace Change, Take Ownership, Make it Happen and Act with Integrity.
Job Type: Full-time

ABOUT BLOCKTRUST
 BlockTrust offers end-to-end NFT, tokenization and compliance solutions to international brands, helping them conceive and deliver a long-term web3 strategy.
 We are working with major brands in commerce, fashion, gaming, sports, entertainment, news and more. We help our partners deploy their branded world, securely white-label their token offerings, privately digitise their physical assets and curators’ creations and - for the first time - truly own their audience data to unlock innovative customer engagement opportunities and new recurrent revenue streams.
 JOB SPECIFICATION
 BlockTrust stands at the forefront with cutting-edge web3 adoption and tokenization solutions as the digital world continues to change quickly. To join our team of developers who continually raise the standard for user experiences, we are searching for a professional blockchain developer. The ideal applicant for a behind-the-scenes position possesses a rare combination of technical know-how and insatiable curiosity, as well as a systematic, analytical approach. When designing and creating mission-critical websites, applications, and infrastructure layers, you should feel at ease working both individually and as part of a team. Experience with GitHub, Terraform, Azure and its ecosystem is helpful for advancing swiftly in this position. Our clients' and our company's success as a whole are directly impacted by our backend developers.
 The ideal candidate will enjoy learning new things, coding, and working with others. At BlockTrust, we place a strong emphasis on encouraging a cooperative culture that invests in the personal advancement of every team member. We want you to realise your full potential, keep learning, like what you do, and ultimately create works of art.
 YOUR MISSION

 Development and design of the BlockTrust platform through automation of build and deployment pipelines..
 Ensure relevant test automation is in place before build and deployment processes are executed
 Participate actively in our Agile rituals, such as standups, story reviews, retros, roadmap planning, and estimating.
 Cooperate and communicate with other team members to ensure the efficient and effective development of new features.

 YOUR PERSONALITY

 Constantly on the lookout for new and innovative ways to solve complex problems through rigorous experimentation.
 Your communication style is open, transparent, and direct, and you consistently work in tight collaboration with your teammates.
 Always open to feedback, new ideas, and opportunities for self-improvement.
 You look for ways to help out beyond the scope of your day-to-day work.
 Possess a strong sense of ownership and have strong attention to detail.

 YOUR JOURNEY

 Experience in an Agile practice with TDD / DDD processes and cloud infrastructure design, with specific attention to containers.
 Experience in microservice architectures and enterprise design patterns.
 Experience with GitHub source control and outstanding DevOps practices, with particular emphasis on Terraform.
 Knowledgeable of the Azure cloud, Azure command line interface (CLI), and architecture patterns in the Azure Well Architected Framework.
 Information and cloud infrastructure security experience.
 What would really make you stand out is experience and/or exposure in the following areas:
 Web3 / blockchain technologies
 Ethereum and Solidity smart contracts
 Layer 2 blockchain networks
 Identity management / Identity protocols
 Cross-platform mobile apps deployment
 Enterprise Service Bus
 Serverless functions

 WHAT WE OFFER

 A distributed working environment in a young, dynamic and fast-growing company.
 A company networked to, and backed by, the biggest names in the blockchain world.
 A team of talented and passionate people who will allow you to further develop your skills in all areas of Web3.
 The opportunity to work on ambitious projects with prestigious international clients.
 A competitive remuneration package.

 About the team It's an exciting time to be joining our growing DevOps engineering team on a journey to transform DevOps/Cloud culture here at Auto & General. We aim to achieve this by establishing a solid automation/cloud foundation and by influencing our internal developer experience.  About you

You take ownership of a situation and lead by being inclusive, collaborative with a positive attitude, and know how to iterate through a problem quickly.
Strive for effective planning/scope and prioritization with stakeholders and the team.
Resilient and comfortable in influencing and communicating with all stakeholders about DevOps practice and subsequent culture shifts
Passionate about DevOps/Cloud/Automation and have a keen interest to solve complex problems in a systematic approach
Passion for mentoring and growing the team’s capabilities and empowering them to achieve successful outcomes.
You enjoy collaborating closely with your DevOps peers and delivery teams to drive continuous improvements/deployments
Mindset for continuous learning and adapting to the ever-changing technology landscape  

Technical skills

Ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects and decompose complex problems down into sprint deliverables in projects and with the team
Drive and expand our Continuously delivery capabilities and Continuous improvements.
Experience implementing automation, Infrastructure as Code (Iac) with Terraform, Ansible and Cloudformation.
Solid experience with building and maintaining sophisticated CI/CD Pipelines & automation with tools like (Gitlab, bitbucket, bamboo, Sonarqube, etc)
Experience with git and implementing branching strategy, and release process
Experience with scaling containers(K8, docker) and serverless architecture
Solid Experience in driving DevOps function in software design and development
Solid experience in implementing and design of AWS cloud solutions in a commercial enterprise environment
Experience in SRE and monitoring complex distributed systems (New Relic)
Experiences implementing security DevOps practices
Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams


 Accountabilities

Provide technical leadership, direction and ensure the team adheres to the technology roadmap and standards.
Drive end-to-end CI/CD technical strategies, migrations of existing solutions and development of new solutions following the Cloud Services technology roadmap.
Drive project technical delivery to ensure DevOps solutions meet and align with the business objective and Cloud Services roadmap/strategy.
Lead and champion an effective collaborative and inclusive environment with Development Managers and Tech Leads to align and influence DevOps practices that enable faster delivery and effective maintenance of cloud infrastructure.
Drive the design and implementation of devops automation foundation and cloud infrastructure using our DevOps principles and industry practices and frameworks.
Establish and maintain relationships with key stakeholders through regular communication to manage agreed outcomes, concerns, risks and issues.
Actively lead in the DevOps team / Cloud Services team’s agile practices to efficiently deliver stakeholder outcomes.
Contribute to building capability in new and junior staff through the sharing of knowledge and experience, active training, coaching and mentoring.
Take ownership to ensure the team is aligned on the technology roadmap, processes and standards.
Keep abreast of the latest practices within the industry and initiate opportunities to improve DevOps standards/practices
Understand and follow the organization’s ITIL practice, Software Delivery Life Cycle, IT Change Management and Incident Management.
Maintain awareness and compliance with company policies and procedures, including completing mandatory training.

Perks

Location –Our head office is conveniently based in Toowong Village shopping centre – a city fringe location with access to retail, restaurants, various parking options and public transport. Workplace giving - If you’re passionate about a cause, then we are too – we offer workplace giving and we’ll dollar match your donations to registered charities.
Development opportunities - We’re championing your development with internal programs and access to a wide range of online courses.
Employee discounts - You’ll receive discounts on Budget Direct insurance products.
Reward and recognition - We reward high performance with employee recognition, reward and incentive schemes.
Onsite facilities - There’s excellent end-of-trip facilities on offer and private spaces for nursing mothers.
Get social - Join our vibrant social and community activities including annual celebrations, family fun days and regular events across each of our sites.
Perks App - Access to an employee benefits and discounts app called ‘Perks’ offering your great discounts, offers and programs across a range of areas. 
WFH- Technology offer a hybrid WFH Model- Two days WFH and Three days in the office.

o Are you a motivated university or TAFE student who would like the opportunity to put the theory you have learned into practice?
 o Would you like to see how high-level Information and Communication Technology (ICT) is deployed in an organisation which is ranked as one of the best in the world in its field?  o Would you like to be part of a work group that produces high quality, professional ICT solutions?


 The Technology and Security Division of the Australian Bureau of Statistics (ABS) is looking for motivated and responsible ICT students to work across various technology and security work programs during the summer vacation period; i.e. from late November 2022 to the end of February 2023.   Following this period, temporary employment opportunities may be available that can fit around your 2023 studies.


 Over the past few years we have recruited around 20 ICT students each year to work in various teams across various locations around Australia. Many of these students have progressed to permanent employment with the ABS (including in our ICT Graduate Program) on completion of their studies.


 What we are looking for


 To be suitable you should have all of the following attributes:



to be eligible for employment with the ABS you must be an Australian citizen
completed a minimum of one year of a relevant ICT degree or diploma
plan to continue your studies in 2023
good communication skills and an ability to work effectively in a team
sound conceptual, analytical and problem-solving skills
a desire to be a part of a professional ICT team
a keen interest and ability in one or more of the following areas:





Cybersecurity Officer – implements effective technology solutions to protect ABS data and information technology from internal and external threats. 


Infrastructure Engineer - operates and controls the ICT infrastructure (hardware, software, and all ICT equipment within wide and local area networks) required to deliver and support ABS’s services and products. 


Cloud Engineer - builds and maintains the ABS’ public cloud infrastructure in AWS and Azure to host performant and secure ABS systems. They develop and leverage engineering tools and processes to effectively provision, install, configure and operate foundational public cloud services, as well as provide expert advice and support for cloud systems in collaboration with development teams. 


Software Developer - designs, creates, tests and documents new and amended software components using on-premise and cloud technologies. 


Business Analyst - analyses and captures ABS business, processes and systems, assessing the business model and its integration with technology. They also help guide the ABS in improving processes, products services and software. 


Test Analyst - ensures the systems and services used by the ABS to undertake its business work effectively. Test Analysts plan, design, manage, execute and report on tests to ensure that new and amended systems, configurations, packages, or services, together with any interfaces, perform as specified, including security requirements. 


DevOps Engineer - facilitates collaboration between development and operations teams in order to achieve increased productivity. DevOps Officers design, create, test and document pipelines for the efficient release and use of new software code and products. 


Microsoft 365 Administrator – provides daily support to all ABS staff for Microsoft Exchange Online and Microsoft Outlook. In addition, Microsoft 365 Administrators contribute to the development and adoption of the rest of the Microsoft 365 services, such as Teams and SharePoint.




 About our Technology and Security Division
 The Technology and Security Division is responsible for the provision of a comprehensive information technology service to the ABS, encompassing mid-range and small-scale computing facilities and associated communications networks.


 We offer a range of ICT career opportunities in app development, infrastructure engineering and cybersecurity.

About Us  At Auto & General (A&G), we provide smarter products and solutions to safeguard our customers in their time of need. We’re excited about the future and we’re always on the lookout for talented, passionate individuals who can help us achieve our goal of being Australia’s best insurer! If this sounds like you, apply today.  Your team  Our team of DevOps Engineers are driving our cloud adoption and as part of empowered E2E agile product teams help drive the modernisation and migration of our critical applications. Tasked with leading the simplification of cloud infrastructure, modernisation, migration and simplification of DevOps toolsets, our team is growing to meet our technology demands.  The role

Contribute to the design and implementation of automation foundations, standards and practices drawing on knowledge of DevOps/Cloud industry practices and frameworks.
Support the adoption of DevOps practices and tooling such as CI/CD, Infrastructure-as-Code, AWS Cloud Computing & Cloud Native architectures
Collaborate closely with Application Development Teams to align and influence DevOps practices that enable faster delivery and effective maintenance of cloud infrastructure.

Establish and maintain relationships with key stakeholders through regular communication to manage agreed outcomes, concerns, risks and issues.
Contribute to the Technology Department strategy and the Cloud roadmap.
Actively participate in the Delivery team's agile practices to efficiently deliver stakeholder outcomes.
Support other Cloud Services team members in the support and troubleshooting of cloud services and infrastructure
Collaborate with Infrastructure and Development teams to identify opportunities for continuous improvements and test new services and technologies that could be of benefit to our platforms.


 About You

Passionate about DevOps/Cloud/Automation and have a keen interest to solve complex problems in a systematic approach.
Resilient and comfortable in influencing and communicating with all stakeholders about DevOps practice and subsequent culture shifts.
You take ownership of a situation by being inclusive, collaborative with a positive attitude, and know how to iterate through a problem quickly.
You enjoy collaborating closely with your DevOps peers and delivery teams to drive continuous improvements/deployments.
Mindset for continuous learning and adapting to the ever-changing technology landscape.


 Technical skills

Passion for e2e automation with infrastructure as Code (Iac) (Terraform, Ansible, Cloudformation)
Experience with git, branching, and release process
Experience with scaling containers(K8, docker) and serverless architecture
Experience in driving DevOps function in software design and development
Experience with building and maintaining sophisticated CI/CD pipelines & automation
Experience in implementing and design of AWS cloud solutions in a commercial enterprise environment
Experience in SRE and monitoring complex distributed systems (New Relic)
Experiences implementing security DevOps practices


 Our perks

Location –Our office is conveniently based in Toowong Village shopping centre - a city fringe location with access to retail, restaurants, various parking options and public transport.

Workplace giving - If you’re passionate about a cause, then we are too – we offer workplace giving and we’ll dollar match your donations to registered charities.
Development opportunities - We’re championing your development with internal programs and access to a wide range of online courses.
Employee discounts - You’ll receive discounts on Budget Direct insurance products.
Reward and recognition - We reward high performance with employee recognition, reward and incentive schemes.
Onsite facilities - There’s excellent end-of-trip facilities on offer and private spaces for nursing mothers.
Get social - Join our vibrant social and community activities including annual celebrations, family fun days and regular events across each of our sites.
Perks App - Access to an employee benefits and discounts app called ‘Perks’ offering your great discounts, offers and programs across a range of areas.
WFH- The Technology team operate a hybrid WFH Model, two days WFH, three days in the office.

Employment Type: Ongoing, Full Time (Flexible Working Arrangements)
Salary: $110,767 - $123,902 per annum + 15.4% employer super contribution
Location: Barton, Canberra


 The Opportunity  DFAT’s Information Management and Technology Division (IMD) are looking for motivated ICT Team Leaders and Senior Technical Officers to develop, deliver and lead ICT capability for the department’s global network. There are opportunities available across the division and ICT operations and are not limited to: User Experience Design, platform services, project management, networking, cryptography, cyber security, ICT governance, ICT strategy, architecture, procurement, contract management, Azure, DevOps and new technology capability development.   As a ICT Team Leader or Senior Technical Officer, you will be a proven ICT professional who can exercise a considerable degree of independence. You will be able to demonstrate effective task prioritisation with sound judgement, strong communication and leadership skills.  Our Ideal Candidate  ICT Team Leader  As an ICT Team Leader, you will be able to apply subject matter expertise to lead a team to achieve efficient and effective ICT outcomes. You will support the strategic direction of the section to enhance the Department’s IT capability, identify learning opportunities for others and empower team members by delegating tasks.  Senior Technical Officer  As a Senior Technical Officer, you will be able to apply domain subject matter expertise to lead a capability to achieve efficient and effective ICT outcomes. You will be a leader in your chosen field with demonstrated experience applying your expertise in a senior technical position in either the public or private sectors.  Qualifications  Qualifications, professional certification or demonstrated equivalent experience in an ICT, Project Management or Cyber Security field is highly desirable.  Eligibility Requirements  Under section 22(8) of the Public Service Act 1999, employees must be Australian citizens to be employed in the Australian Public Service (APS) unless the Agency Head has agreed otherwise, in writing.  The department requires the successful candidate to obtain and maintain a Negative Vetting 2 level clearance security clearance (Negative Vetting Level 1 or Positive Vetting (PV) where positions are designated as such in the DFAT Security Framework or PV organisational chart, respectively). Loss of a security clearance at any time may lead to termination of employment. Employment with the department can, however, commence on lower-level clearances or without a clearance, in some circumstances, and the department will work with you to facilitate this if you are successful.  Depending on the role into which you are placed, you may also be required to obtain and maintain a Working with Vulnerable People/Children registration (or equivalent).  Application Details   Your application will need to provide: 

your personal details;
a one page pitch/no more than 800 words or one page upload;
a maximum four-page CV (uploaded); and
contact details of two referees (one being your current supervisor).

 Your application will be assessed on your ability to demonstrate, or have the potential to develop, the required skills, knowledge, experience, and qualifications, to proficiently perform the role. Relevant examples and accomplishments will strengthen your application. 
 
 The requirements of the role are based on the information provided to you as part of the job advertisement, in line with the APS Work Level Standards (WLS). 
 

For more information about the role, including duties and How to Apply please refer to the Applicant Pack.


Applications close Friday 16th September at 11:30PM AEST.

 Job Ref: A2027/2022

Description:
 DevOps Specialist 

 About our team 

 A Digital, Customer & Marketing consultancy with the backing of a top-tier firm. Deloitte Digital is where business, creativity and technology intersect to craft beautifully seamless experiences that deliver business outcomes. With a wonderful mix of designers, strategists, technologists and makers, we are a powerhouse committed to transforming experiences and making an impact that enriches people’s lives 

 About the role 

 Deloitte Digital’s Delivery Operations team is responsible for enabling our delivery teams to do their job through providing tooling, infrastructure, and DevOps services. Our business is growing, and we are after an experienced Cloud and Platform Specialist to join the team. 

 This role is primarily technical in nature but with a consulting element. You are an Australian citizen who is an experienced in cloud hosting (primarily AWS and Azure), infrastructure-as-code tools (e.g., Terraform), containerisation technologies (primarily Kubernetes and Docker), and has implemented DevSecOps pipelines (for example build and run-time image scanning, vulnerability scanning and intrusion detection). Additionally, you enjoy working with a team of DevOps engineers who work with a wide variety of systems. 


Activities the team work on include:
 Infrastructure automation 
Cloud platforms 
DevOps pipelines 
Security and compliance 
Provision of internal tools used by Deloitte Digital 
Monitoring, logging, and alerting systems 
Automation of anything and everything. 


As part of this team, you will be responsible for:
 Design and implementation of cloud-hosted solutions for internal and external clients using tools such as Terraform 
Designing, implementing, and maintaining modular or templated solutions that will be used by a national practice of technical and design teams 
Ensuring security is built into everything we do 
Working with bid teams to estimate and cost solutions for client proposals 
Working directly with internal teams and clients to discuss requirements, taking ownership of medium to high complexity technical tasks and providing status updates 
Identifying technical improvements and upgrades 
Proactively identifying better ways of delivering our services 
Staying current with best practice and identifying ways we can enhance our approach 
Recommending and executing process improvements 
Providing subject matter experience to teams, helping troubleshoot particularly complex or interesting issues 

 About your experience 

 You have proven technical experience delivering solutions based on Kubernetes, developing and delivering infrastructure automation using tools like Terraform, familiarity with DevOps pipelines and code repository tools like Bitbucket or Github, and an understanding of how to use automation to improve efficiencies in development lifecycles. To be awesome in this role you must have (mandatory experience): 

 5+ years of DevOps/Sysadmin experience, ideally gained in a consulting / agency environment with tier one clients 
Comfortable using both Windows and Linux environments 
Production hosting experience with Amazon Web Services or Azure 
Deploying and managing Kubernetes workloads in a cloud hosting environment 
Designing and implementing Azure DevOps pipelines 
Designing and implementing Terraform code 
Self-motivated, problem-crushing attitude 
Awesome war stories of all the technical problems you solved to get to this point 
Being a team player who just wants things to work reliably and consistently 
An opinion on the best way to do things, while remaining open minded to new ideas 


Desirable experience (will be considered an advantage):
 6+ years of DevOps/sysadmin experience, ideally gained in a consulting / agency environment with tier one clients 
Azure and AWS administration (Azure Active Directory admin, AWS IAM policies etc) 
Monitoring, logging, and alerting solutions – Dynatrace, Sumo Logic, OpsGenie 
Atlassian suite Administration – Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket 
Software Engineering or Computer Science tertiary qualifications 
SQL database management or administration 
Understanding of ITIL service delivery lifecycle 
System engineering or system administration 
Continuous Integration and Delivery 
Automation tools – scripting, Ansible, Packer, etc. 
Deploying or maintaining security mechanisms such as Hashicorp Vault 
Enterprise, web or mobile application development 
Proven application or systems solution architecture experience 

 Why Deloitte? 

 At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. Deloitte Australia opens the door to a career that can cross borders virtually and physically across Asia Pacific to gain experience and access projects beyond Australia’s borders. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in a variety of ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated. 

 We’re committed to continually building a safe and respectful workplace, where all our people feel appreciated and accepted. Through the creation of endorsed employee-led diversity networks which promote cultural, disability, LGBTI+, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and gender equality, we’re leading the way to shape an environment where everybody can thrive. 

 We are proud to have been recognised for our efforts in inspiring change and accelerating progress – check out our careers site for recent recognition in this space.

Our client is a fast-growing tech company with global presence and offices across Australia. They provide world class cloud services through multi-channels and offering superior service to their customers.
 Reporting to the Software Manager, the role of the DevOps Engineer will commence immediately working mainly independently but surrounded by a team of highly experienced software engineers. The DevOps Engineer will have a deep understanding of cloud technology and assist the team in designing, developing and deploying pipeline into AWS.
 Being a highly valuable team member, you will be required to hit the ground running and have valuable input in the team meetings and workshops.
 Responsibilities

Demonstrate fluency in emerging DevOps-centric automation tools and technologies for CI/CD and configuration management
Create, manages and use dashboard for continuous monitoring and health check of applications for the underlying infrastructure,
Improve the quality of services using the monitoring feedback for non-production environment
Maintain services once they are live by measuring and monitoring availability, latency and overall system health
Scale systems sustainably through automation and evolve systems by pushing for changes to improve reliability and velocity
Contribute to the future improvement of software delivery processes and operations, e.g., cloud enablement, use of microservices with containerization

Essential skills and experience

 About the team:



 Xero’s Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) Eventing team owns and supports the Confluent Cloud hosted Apache Kafka platform to facilitate high volume eventing within software engineering teams and across Xero domains.
  


 You will be part of the Platform-as-a-Service group, which is a cross-functional agile infrastructure development team.  What we do:



 At Xero, our objective is to be a truly data savvy organisation where widespread, reliable, timely movement of events are a trigger for better insights and a smarter user experience. For us, it’s about building strong partnerships with our eventing platform consumers - to learn and evolve our platform for ease of use, in order to make data the central nervous system of Xero. We’re looking to grow our Eventing team to really bring this vision to life. Join us - you’ll have a front row seat, plenty of room to grow and a committed team behind you.

 Experience writing APIs and infrastructure-as-code.
 Experience of modern product and engineering principles and practices.
 Great communication skills
 Growth mindset with a love of experimentation and learning
 Being a great team member, including the ability to work with others and navigate areas of conflict in an open, positive and proactive way.

 You can choose to perform this role:
  

In one of our #beautiful offices

 At Xero we support many types of flexible working arrangements that allow you to balance your work, your life and your passions. Job Summary


This is a position reporting to the Development Capability Manager in OSS Engineering within Application Engineering business unit and Group IT division.
The DevOps Engineer role is an essential role in the Application Engineering Operations team working with stakeholders in both business and engineering teams to ensure the effective delivery of supporting operational tasks including Incident, Problem and Change management.
The incumbent is responsible for proactively maintaining & Developing Core Telco Systems (CTS) so that risks to loss of availability or performance are mitigated before an impact occurs. CTS systems must be available a minimum of 99.95% of the time.


Key Responsibilities



Maintain and improve system performance and operational efficiency by reducing service downtime and maintaining or reducing transaction duration times.
Deliver Change / Demand requests across IT OSS Engineering Platforms that are Medium/Complex/Project based in nature
Complete all required/mandatory training courses within the allocated timeframes.
Liaise with stakeholders such as internal and external development teams, and relevant IT teams ensuring all stakeholders are considered and are informed of issues and risks in production.
Develop Subject Matter Expertise for the managed CTS Products and Platforms. Ensure that all standard operating procedures, known issues and workarounds are documented in the knowledge support systems.
Follow Change Management processes and procedures ensuring all necessary documentation is completed in necessary timeframes.
Perform test support, implementation planning and execution of BAU configuration, enhancement and defect releases and participate in Post Implementation Testing required for changes and fixes implemented into production as required.
Actively drive incident resolution and system restoration within SLA’s. This will be measured by the IT fault management reporting systems.

Experience and Qualifications



A minimum of 3 years’ industry experience working in an IT operations team of a large complex organization such as a Tier 1 Telco or Bank.

OSS Platform with a Tier 1 vendor platform Experience essential.
Understanding of BSS (Billing and Customer Care Platforms. Thorough experience of the fulfilment environment, specifically in relation to Service Order Management, Service Inventory, Service Activation)

 With a sufficient timezone overlap with the team, we're able to hire eligible candidates for this role from any location in Australia and New Zealand. 


   We're looking for a technologist with a passion for driving engineering and operational excellence improvements. Our team provides the data, tooling, processes and rituals that Atlassian teams, engineering managers and execs use to help them determine where they need to focus to build better systems. We work with domain experts across developer tooling, compliance, security, support, performance, reliability, incident management, team processes and more.
  

    Atlassian is growing fast and our challenge is to grow at the right speed in the right way. hummgroup (ASX-HUM) is one of Australasia’s most successful and enduring fintech organisations with a proud legacy of rewriting the playbook for digital spending. We help people buy everything, everywhere, every day. Our product ecosystem of buy now pay later, credit cards, and business financing products has been designed around the core needs of today's shoppers, retailers, and small and medium enterprises.
 What does an average day look like? 
Working closely across our Technology teams, you will be the technical liaison for Engineering and Operations on every aspect working to identify and highlight areas for DevOps improvements.
 No two days will ever be the same. This is an exciting role which provides you with immerse diversity and responsibility.
 To give you an indication of your key responsibilities, you will:

 Build, automate, create, and maintain CICD pipelines.

 Analyse and evaluate design options and execute process improvements.

 Build effective working relationships with operational and product teams.
 Foster cross-functional teamwork & collaboration within the wider group.

 Who will thrive in this role?
 Our Release Engineer interfaces across the organisation, so your exceptional communication abilities, agile mindset and collaborative ethos will be crucial to your success.

 This is a technical role, so you’ll need:

 Proven experience as a DevOps Engineer, preferably with A tertiary or vocational qualification that is relevant to software development and DevOps (beneficial).

 Good knowledge and experience with Build and Release automation tools such as Azure DevOps, Ansible, Terraform, Octopus Deploy and GIT.

 Deep understanding of core banking systems such as CMS, credit and fraud. Knowledge of S2m Select, Transact, Illion, Interflow, and GBG products are advantageous.

OVERVIEW:
 


   At Sportradar we’ve experienced a wonderful period of sustained hypergrowth through a highly focused strategy based upon industry leading product innovation. To continue on this trajectory, we’re looking for an addition to a group of highly experienced engineers in a DevOps solutions and technology team. Working closely with engineering teams to foster a strong culture of collaboration, system development lifecycles and infrastructure as code practices. Develop and support high quality digital solutions, with a focus on building operational awareness, supporting configuration management and ensuring quality. Become integral to a team of software developers, test analysts and product owners as part of the DevOps Practice.
 

   Sportradar is a truly digital organisation with a very broad array of B2B applications and services. As we embark on a very exciting technical transformation with a focus on cloud migration and microservice architectures, it is a great time to join our team!
 

   Sportradar is a global company. The role is based in London with overseas travel as required to ensure effective collaboration and project support.
 


   THE CHALLENGE:
 


   To succeed in this role, you have a diverse background with software development as a senior technical and people leader. You should have a passion for DevOps, extensive experience of tooling centric to software crafting/hosting and an expert level understanding of software quality, reliability, release and scaling principles. You will have experience setting up continuous integration/delivery in agile teams. In addition, you will have operational experience with system administration or site reliability engineering which allows you to craft and maintain resilient systems. You will also have a natural desire to automate all things, coach and guide your peer development community and a passion for reproducible results.
 


   There are several key challenge areas:
 

 DevOps evangelism and people mentor-ship
 Design, build and improve the software delivery life-cycle for a broad array of products and services.
 Automate the creation and management of our software platforms.
 Craft reusable frameworks that simplify platform, delivery and observability.
 Enable teams to work efficiently and effectively through technology and ways of working solutions.
 Help drive excellence in development, quality assurance and operational teams.



   YOUR PROFILE:
 


 A technical and people leader, with a passion for results
 Proficient in Kubernetes container orchestration and administration.
 Proficient in deploying and running applications in Kubernetes.
 In depth Cloud experience with either AWS, Azure or GCP (at least 2 years).
 Detailed knowledge of GNU/Linux OS (at least 3 years of experience w/ administration of production grade services running on Linux server).
 Application development, technical architecture or application support experience in an agile / continuous delivery environment.
 Excellent experience creating Operational Awareness through monitoring and alerting solutions.
 Highly proficient with IaC and Configuration Management tooling (Terraform, Ansible, Puppet, Chef)
 Strong understanding of CI/CD pipelines (at least 2 years).
 Strong scripting skills (ability to write Bash script, Python / Ruby / Go / other).
 Excellence with version control systems and application lifecycle management (Git / GitLab).
 Excellent communicator at all levels.
 A team leader with a strong sense of collaboration and personal development.



   OUR OFFER:
 


 Working within a well-established team of experienced DevOps engineers.
 Work with Kubernetes, microservice architectures, cloud providers and other modern and exciting technologies.
 Collaborate with supporting colleagues from all over the world.
 The opportunity to work and develop within an inspiring and fast-growing company.
 A challenging but rewarding and fun environment.



   SPORTRADAR:
 


   Sportradar is a global leader in collecting, analysing and leveraging the power of sports data and digital content for its clients around the world. We provide cutting-edge solutions and services to media companies, bookmakers, sports federations and state authorities.
 

   We are a truly international business employing over 2,000 people in more than 30 locations around the world. Our rapid growth has been driven by technological innovation alongside an understanding of our clients' business needs. It is our commitment to excellent service, quality and reliability that makes us the trusted partner of more than 1,000 companies in over 100 countries.
 

   We occupy a unique position at the intersection of the sports, media and betting industries. This creates an exciting and fast-moving working environment that rewards creative thinking and hard work. We are passionate about what we do, and we care passionately about our people.
 

   If you think you're up to the challenge, come and help us to grow, innovate and develop!
 

   Your differences help shape our future
 

   #Maketheteam

Bachelor or above degree in Computer Science

We also have big ears for feedback from customers to help us continually improve the Baraja experience. We are pretty good at what we do (but definitely not perfect), so you'll be learning from and working with a top-flight team on a mission to be better every day.


 What matters to us
 We believe that our culture is one of our most important assets and we've wrapped it up with three key values that we do our best to live up to every day:
 Hustle to deliver on hard and meaningful problems - Passion to achieve. Resilience & learning. What's the next challenge?

 Capgemini Financial Services is a Global Strategic Business Unit that provides information technology and consultancy services to the Banking, Capital Markets and Insurance industries. and information management requirements

To remove impediments and foster an environment for high-performing team dynamics, continuous flow and improvement whilst advocating agile framework
Dealing with ambiguity - pull apart complex, incompletely defined problems and solve them with your development teams

Extensive delivery leadership experience, comfortable working across multiple teams, geographically dispersed (Brisbane, Perth, Montreal, Salt Lake, Mongolia).
Excellent people leadership and solution oriented, with customer collaboration skills
Demonstrated delivery of initiatives in a timely manner and ability to navigate through ambiguous situations and opportunities

Alternatively, for a confidential discussion, please contact Kylie Graham from our Brisbane office on (07) 3185 5339 or Kylie.Graham@hudson.com, quoting reference number 217226.

Our Story 
At WooliesX, our people believe in creating better everyday experiences for our community.  With 1,800+ team members, multiple practices and over 100 chapters, there’s a home for everyone here. Whether your interests lie in data driven insights and product engineering, digital media, ecom, operations, customer advocacy, commercial, agile or more, you can find your squad across all kinds of capabilities.  Our squads live their “one day”, every day. We work on Australia’s most innovative tech, design, engineering and more to transform the way that millions of Australians live and shop. Physically, you can find us in Surry Hills, but virtually, we can be anywhere.  Our culture combines the support, care and freedom that comes with being part of the Woolworths Group. The Position 
WooliesX is seeking a Tech Lead to join our team. In this role, you will be helping design solutions for connecting various internal and external platforms to help drive the future of shopping in Australia. The candidate will be responsible for developing and communicating integration plans to a team of cross functional developers, enabling them to deliver deeper integrations between platforms.

 The ideal candidate will possess

Technical Capabilities 

Experience understanding and connecting with various platforms 
Experience designing technical solutions 
Experience with secure coding practices and microservices architecture

Comfortable with writing queries for the database like SQL server, Firebase, Firestore and NoSQL databases (Mongo) 


Knowledge of, experience preferred: 


Node.js 
GraphQL 
.NET 
AEM 
Android/iOS app development 
Backend for frontends (BFF) 


 Responsibilities 

Collaborate with your product and engineering team members, contributing and evolving ideas to deliver simple solutions to complex problems 
Offer smart engineering ways to experiment and prototype features rapidly whilst constantly delivering customer value 
Partner across engineering teams to design, deliver and maintain operationally efficient, robust and resilient systems that align with the tech strategy 
Empower your team members, value the success of the team as a whole and mentor and coach your fellow team members 
Take ownership of your role, team and the solutions that the team creates 
Set the standard for thorough and meaningful code reviews, better engineering practices and standards, improved continuous integration and delivery processes 

 What's in it for you

Flexible work from home with your team’s agreement. 
Tech options - Woolworths are the largest employer of Google Apps in Australia, are early adopters of Agile and have BYOD options too.

The Appian BPM Application Administrator serves as the primary technical authority for Appian application operations and is responsible for managing all Appian related application deployments, administration, troubleshooting, maintenance, and technical support activities.


RESPONSIBILTIES:
 

Establishes and maintains user accounts, assigns file permissions and establishes password and account policies.
 Installs, upgrades, configures, tests, maintains and supports operating system software in a production environment.
 

Responsible for effective provisioning, installation/configuration, operation, and maintenance of systems hardware and software and related infrastructure.
Reviews performance logs and monitors system performance. Troubleshoots and resolves system hardware, software and communications problems; creates shell programs and utility scripts; performs configurations and adjustments to enhance database file capacity; performs automated and manual backup and restore processes.
 Installs, configures and tests software packages. Participates in technical research and development to enable continuing innovation within the infrastructure.
 

Ensures that system hardware, operating systems, software systems, and related procedures adhere to organizational values.
Provides user support and may conducts user software and hardware training to formulate technology solutions and ensure the effective safeguarding and sharing of enterprise data.
Evaluates requests for hardware and software; researches and recommends solutions to technology needs, compatible with the client’s technology architecture and infrastructure and resource constraints.
Performs and/or oversees daily system monitoring, verifying the integrity and availability of all hardware, server resources, systems and key processes, reviewing system and application logs, and verifying completion of scheduled jobs such as backups.
Performs and/or oversees daily backup operations, ensuring all required file systems and system data are successfully backed up to the appropriate media, recovery tapes or disks are created, and media is recycled and sent off site as necessary.
Provides team leadership and technical guidance to less experienced systems administrators.


 Desired Experience:


Experience managing the Appian BPM application on a Windows-based platform.
Experience managing multiple Appian-based applications and associated permissions.
Experience monitoring and correcting Appian processes.
Experience correcting KDB file corruptions
Experience applying Appian patches and software updates and migrating Appian software and services to upgraded hardware and software platforms


 MUST HAVE:
 Appian L1 certification (the candidate can do it post selection to this role as well, but needs to be certified on Day 1)
 

GOOD TO HAVE:
 Appian Certified Application Designer (ACAD)
  DevOps automation

Hybrid working environment - great balance between working from home and office
Join an organisation dedicated to helping Australians improve their health
Permanent, full-time opportunity


About us

 Healthdirect Australia is a government-owned, not-for-profit organisation who works with purpose and dedication to help Australians actively manage and improve their health.
 
 Our virtual services are easily accessible via multiple channels, including helplines, apps, video call solutions and websites and cater for Australians at all stages of life, ranging from practical and emotional support during pregnancy through to advice about aged care and helping Australians through the COVID-19 pandemic. No matter where people live, or what time of the day or night it is, they can use our services to talk to a health professional, find trusted information and advice online and locate their closest health service.
 

About the opportunity

 We are looking for a Mid-level DevOps Engineer to join our innovation focused Technology division and serve as the interface between projects teams, the Healthdirect platform and the Operations teams. Their mission is to work within project or platform teams to implement infrastructure in a continuous delivery approach and to assist in continuous integration and deployment.
 
 Key responsibilities of the role include:
 

Work in project teams and write high quality infrastructure and automation code
Assist in socialising infrastructure policies and practices
Develop and implement infrastructure documents, automated scripts and configuration profiles
Work with key stakeholders and vendors to ensure technical infrastructure is properly considered in all aspects of solutions design and planning
Assist in the development and review of infrastructure architectures in the Healthdirect environment and for integration with outside sources
Work with project teams and work towards the migration of legacy technology to new infrastructure solution.
Coordinate packaging and release schedules
Ensure compliance with operational acceptance testing
Assist in the creation of dashboards and metrics to visualise the success of infrastructure and DevOps practices
This role may have the opportunity to be on call and be compensated accordingly.
 

What we’re looking for

 If you have any of the below skills/experience and thrive in a fast paced environment that is committed to supporting Australians, we would love to hear from you.
 

3+ years’ experience working in an AWS cloud DevOps environment (VPC, EC2, ALB/NLB, Lambda etc)
3+ years writing scripts and code in a variety of open-source technologies – including Infrastructure as Code scripting languages eg CloudFormation
Experience working with service management, networking and infrastructure
Experience in coding in a number of DevOps targeted languages, such as Python, Shell, Node etc.
Ability to design and create infrastructure architecture documents as part of a solution design team
Experience in AWS Security “perimeter ingress” components (WAF, Shield, CloudFront, API Gateway)
Thorough understanding of agile software development methodologies, values, and procedures

Why work with us

 We believe our strength comes from our talented and dedicated staff and we work hard to deliver an environment where you can enjoy your role and are rewarded for it, from offering competitive remuneration packages through to providing the opportunity to make a daily difference in the lives of others.
 
 While our office is a valuable place for our employees to collaborate and socialise, we also offer the freedom to decide when and for what purpose. At Healthdirect, we believe flexible work is more than remote working and laptops, we consult with our employees to work out what is most effective to help each person balance work and life.
  As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills, and experiences within our workforce.
 
 To find out more about our vision for a healthier Australia that you could be a part of, see our 2021-24 Strategic Plan at https://ahealthieraustralia.healthdirect.gov.au
 

Please be aware that you must have the right to live and work in Australia to apply for this job.

        Insignia Financial is one of Australia’s leading Wealth Management organisations, undertaking a rapid and exciting transformation. We are a strong and resilient business, and we are investing in supporting our people to onboard and connect them remotely in the current environment. It is in this context that we are looking for a Senior DevOps Engineer.
       



The Role


        In this role, you will lead collaboratively with software and system engineers to deploy and operate our systems, help automate and streamline our operations and processes, build and maintain tools for deployment, monitoring and operations, and troubleshoot and resolve issues in our dev, test and production environments.
       



        The role requires you to have hands-on technical experience and a can-do approach towards environment automation and continuous improvement.
       



        The Senior DevOps Engineer will create and manage the development systems, structure, tools, and resources that support our infrastructure and assets.
       



Key Responsibilities:


Work with our software engineers to design, automate, deploy, monitor and continuously improve all our environments, tools, and processes
Help maintain source code management, continuous test, and deployment services for our engineering department
Monitor and optimise our environments and where possible cost optimisation
Provide guidance to junior team members & developers
Collaborate with the team to improve engineering tools, systems and procedures
Automate and streamline as much as possible
Improve our build scripts and enhance our pipelines





To Be Successful in This Role You Will Possess:


5+ years' experience in a similar role.
Relevant industry/vendor certifications in software release management.
Postgraduate technical qualifications would be an advantage. 
Experience with Java background.
Strong cloud infrastructure experience with a focus on web applications. 
Professional experience on operating Amazon AWS Cloud (EC2, VPC, VPN, EBS, S3, Route53, IAM, AWS CLI etc).
Experience in automating AWS resource creation using Cloudformation/Terraform templates.
Experience with Docker.
Professional Experience with continuous delivery environments like Jenkins or TeamCity.
Comfortable with Bash, Python, and Ansible.





Benefits


In return, we offer development opportunities at an ASX top 200 company
A professional, supportive and friendly culture
A range of corporate and lifestyle benefits





The Business


        IOOF is one of Australia’s leading wealth management organisations, undertaking a rapid and exciting transformation. The IOOF group has been helping Australians secure their future since 1846. During that time, we have grown substantially to become a leading provider of quality financial services. We now manage and administer more than $200 billion of client monies and are listed on the Australian Securities Exchange in the ASX top 200 (ASX:IFL).
