About Capgemini 

 Capgemini is a diverse collective of more than 330,000 strategic and technological experts based across more than 50 countries, partnering with world-renowned clients to transform and manage their businesses. We are dedicated to leveraging cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering, and platforms to address the entire breadth of their business needs. This passion drives a powerful commitment - to unlock the true value of technology. 
Over the last 18 months, we have tripled our business in Australia and New Zealand, with over 3,300 team members devoted to helping clients get the future they want. Now is the time to join our rapidly growing team who are at the forefront of finding new ways technology can help us reimagine what's possible, collecting unique career experiences with global brands and game-changing tech projects. 


Let's talk about the role and responsibilities:


Delivering data-oriented solutions utilising big data, data warehousing, operational insight, data management or business intelligence.
Engaging with customers to develop and enhance customer and stakeholder relationships.
Specifying and documenting business requirements as directed, ensuring traceability back to source. Working with stakeholders to prioritise requirements.
Defining scope and business priorities for small-scale changes and may assist in larger scale scoping exercises.
Taking responsibility for understanding client requirements, collecting data, delivering analysis and problem resolution. Identifying, evaluating, and recommending options, implementing if required.

Let's talk about your capability and experience:


Knowledge of modern data platforms and how to architect solutions from end-to-end.
Experience in the Microsoft Data Stack including SQL Server, SSIS, SSRS, SSAS
Suitable knowledge of the Microsoft cloud data platform including Power BI, Azure Data Factory, Data Lake, SQL, Azure Synapse, and Databricks.
Experience in programming languages such as Python and C# would be beneficial.
Some background or hands-on knowledge of the Microsoft AI & ML, Azure integration stack & Azure IoT stack would be beneficial.
Suitable background or hands-on knowledge of the Microsoft DevOps stack including CI/CD toolsets and processes.
Knowledge in customer engagement and requirements gathering.
 Let's talk about what's in it for you! 

 We believe technology is about more than business transformation - it's also about building a more sustainable, inclusive future. This starts with our people, working with you to get the future you want. We invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work, contributing to our inclusive culture and a safe place for our people to be themselves and truly belong. Through championing our staff-led community groups, we are committed to being active allies for everyone. We also aim to build an environment where you can thrive at work and at home. We champion remote working - even though you'll want to check out our beautiful offices - and are in the process of making ‘truly flexible' working arrangements the day-to-day reality for our people. In addition, we strive to ensure your growth and learning experience is unique with access to leading learning platforms, external certifications and opportunities to grow and learn the way you want. Finally, we offer opportunities to use your skills to help society address the impact of the digital and automation revolution, and we're ruthlessly focused on sustainability for our clients and our business - committing to becoming a net zero business by 2030. 
We work to recruit and retain a talented and diverse workforce. We strongly encourage applications from suitably qualified candidates regardless of their gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religion, ability, intersex status or age. 
Capgemini Australia has developed and manages, process orientated Management Systems compliant to the requirements of ISO9001, ISO27001 and ISO14001. We are committed to delivering secure solutions and services through state-of-the-art processes and continual improvement frameworks in line with industry best practices as well as contractual, statutory and regulatory requirements. 
#GetTheFutureYouWant - Come join us, bring your whole self to work, create new possibilities for you, your customers and your community and help us to be Architects of Positive Futures. 

 Please note unsolicited resumes from employment agencies or other third parties will not be considered. 
#LI-MO1

As the DevOps Engineer, your purpose and unique contribution is to implement and validate solutions for business application systems to both on premise and cloud-based infrastructure while ensuring high availability on both production and pre-production systems. You are part of a development and operations team delivering on design, build, release, deployment and support activities.


For this role to make a difference, you will be a quality expert, passionate in delivering working and usable applications to our customers. You will have outstanding skills and experience in the Middleware DevOps products you support and be an advocate for improvements in processes and work practices, as well as governance and standards. You will be responsible for the design and implementation of applications’ build, release, deployment, and configuration activities.


Responsibilities

Prepare reports, manuals and other documentation on the status, operation of supported products
Design, develop, and unit test solutions
Participate in peer-reviews of solution designs and related code
Package and support deployment of releases
Analyse, troubleshoot and resolve technical and application issues
Provide support to business users
Contribute to knowledge sharing and mentoring
Contribute to future technology roadmap
Implement and support solutions
Monitor solutions managed and supported by the team
Automate implementation and support activities
Participate in the on-call support roster
Contribute to a continuous improvement/culture and fosters new ideas


 
Key Skills and Experience

Cloud solutions: (either AWS, or Azure)
5+ years experience in a development and operational support team
Experience working with source control: GIT, Nexus
Continuous delivery tools (CI/CD)
Infrastructure as code: Terraform, Ansible, Packer, CloudFormation, Containers, Orchestration and packaging tools: Docker, Kubernetes, Rancher, RKE, Helm and Helm Charts
IT Operations and monitoring tools: Splunk, Prometheus, Grafana, CloudWatch logs, CloudWatch Agent, CloudWatch Alarms, NewRelic
Experience in multiple technology fields including Operating systems: Windows, CentOS, and RedHat Enterprise Linux
Common middleware software: Apache, Nginx, Traefik, Tomcat, Redhat, Oracle WebLogic
Database technologies PostgresQ, MySQL, DynamoDB)
Continuous Integration tools (Bamboo, Jenkins, Rancher)
Automation languages (Ansible, Puppet)
Scripting, automation: bash, Python, cron, AWS Lambda, One or more programming language (NodeJS, Ruby, Java)
Highly developed analytical and problem solving skills
Excellent verbal and written presentation, facilitation and communication skills
Hold the ability to clearly communicate complex technical ideas to both business, representatives and IT colleagues
Has a systematic, disciplined and analytical approach to problem solving


 
About Us
At IAG, we believe that everyone has a unique point of view to share, shaped by their life experiences, cultures & passions. We celebrate and commit to:
#Proud to be me – we value difference, not sameness
#Together – harnessing our collective wisdom enables us to be our best for our customers & each other
#No boxes – it’s not about labels, boxes or categories. It’s about building a diverse and inclusive mindset into everything we do.


IAG is the largest general insurance group in Australia and New Zealand. IAG owns some of the region’s most trusted brands, including NRMA Insurance, CGU, SGIO, SGIC and WFI.


Let’s Talk


In addition to a diverse and inclusive culture, some of our benefits include 13% superannuation, 50% insurance discounts, flexible work and leave options, generous parental leave and return to work program, recognition and reward program, and various corporate partner discounts.


We encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders to apply for this position.

job_summary:
Job Posting Title
 DevOps Engineer
 
 Summary
 We're looking for a Senior DevOps Engineer to help drive innovation and implement fit for purpose solution that will underpin our technical platform for the next 3-5 years. This role will involve working across multiple teams to understand requirements and progressively align our core infrastructure and platforms to standardized automated builds that can be deployed anywhere onto any host environments. 
 
 This role will require a person that is comfortable researching, implementing, mentoring and presenting ideas and opportunities across teams in multiple locations globally.
 
 What You'll Do


 Working closely with senior stakeholders to formulate technical plans and target state to enable cloud agnostic deployments of Aristocrat systems, applications, and platforms.
 Develop, document, communicate best practices and benefits of standardization and automation
 Working closely with multiple development teams to ensure build and deployment pipelines are aligned with technical ambitions and target state
 Create and update cloud agnostic API/microservice design and documentation
 Perform code reviews and ensure coding standards are followed and code is written in alignment with the DevOps principles
 Work with development teams to ensure new requirements are fed into the DevOps backlog in a timely manner
 Work with Test QAs to ensure all quality gates are applied on all deliverables
 Create production support walkthrough document


 What We're Looking For


 Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information systems management or related field
 A strong background in DevOps, working as a DevOps Consultant, Engineer, Architect or similar
 5+ years of experience of delivering DevOps functionality both on premise and multiple cloud environments
 Expertise in delivering Infrastructure/Platform/Software as a Service
 Expertise in Terraform and Ansible
 Expert level knowledge and experience in one or more public cloud platform
 Proven track record creating a common architecture vision and implementing the strategic alignment across multiple teams
 3years of demonstratable and significant experience of implementing Docker and Kubernetes in an enterprise environment
 Experience with design of Micro Service Architectures
 3+ years of experience of delivering CI/CD pipelines to automate everything*
 Strong interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills, with the ability to develop and conduct presentations to peers and management teams
 Self-directed with the ability manage own work and life balance


 Why Aristocrat?

 Aristocrat is a world leader in gaming content and technology, and a top-tier publisher of free-to-play mobile games. We deliver great performance for our B2B customers and bring joy to the lives of the millions of people who love to play our casino and mobile games. And while we focus on fun, we never forget our responsibilities. We strive to lead the way in responsible gameplay, and to lift the bar in company governance, employee wellbeing and sustainability. We’re a diverse business united by shared values and an inspiring mission to bring joy to life through the power of play.

 We aim to create an environment where individual differences are valued, and all employees have the opportunity to realize their potential. We welcome and encourage applications from all people regardless of age, gender, race, ethnicity, cultural background, disability status or LGBTQ+ identity. We offer a range of flexible working options through all.flex, our flexible hybrid work model and invite you to have a conversation with us about flexible working. EEO M/F/D/V

 World Leader in Gaming Entertainment
 Robust benefits package
 Global career opportunities


 Our Values

 All about the Player
 Talent Unleashed
 Collective Brilliance
 Good Business Good Citizen


 The US based roles may require registration with the Nevada Gaming Control Board (NGCB) and/or other gaming jurisdictions in which we operate.

Preacta are on the lookout for multiple AWS DevOps Engineers to join our client within intelligence and security.
  To dive right in, you'll be an integral part of building out and growing the DevOps team in this function of the business, address the unmet needs of the group across multiple business disciplines. Dive into complex environments and be a part of establishing best practices and challenge the status quo. You will be joining a pioneer in the investigative SaaS space, who continuously evolve and upgrade their platform.
 
 In this hands-on AWS DevOps Engineer role, you will be responsible for the technology that supports client onboarding, maintenance, and review process for clients, work within an agile way and support the wider engineering team to digitize the customer journey.
  Along with maintenance & management of cloud resources, integrations tools & services, containerization, and cost optimization within AWS across the Business.
 

Day to Day tasks will include:


Create infrastructure in AWS eco systems
Build out EKS Infrastructure for their SaaS product using EKS and Terraform.
Implement and maintain CICD Pipeline, deploying applications to a global SaaS offering.
Work closely with various business units, i.e., developers, architect, and product.
Set up and implement DevOps in line with industry best practice
Be a valuable contribution in building team culture within a newly created team
Implement and maintain observability (APM,K8'S monitoring), logs and alerts across cloud deployments.


Skills and Experience needed include:

Experience with Kubernetes Engine (EKS).

Continuous deployment delivery (CI/CD)

 For more information on this opportunity please don’t hesitate to apply and I will give you a call to discuss. For more information, please speak to Donna at Preacta recruitment

Description

 About Us
 Civica (www.civica.com) is a market-leading specialist in business-critical software applications, digital solutions and managed services that help teams and organisations around the world to transform the way they work. Civica’s Heath & Care solutions for community care and private health insurance are used widely in organisations including councils, not-for-profit, and private health providers to help meet the changing needs of their communities.
 Our team is proud to work within the sectors we do, where we make a real difference, contributing to the growth of the societies that we live in. Want to join us and help continue our mission?
 About The Role
 Exceptional opportunity for an experienced and dynamic DevOps Developer to join Civica based in Australia. As part of our high performing Local Government business unit, you will be an integral hands-on addition to the already established team. Supported by senior leadership this permanent role will see you focus on script development and process automation. Collaborating with various stakeholders you will display exceptional communication skills with the ability to translate technical requirements and bridge the gap between development and our customers. You will bring your solid experience with various tools and design artefacts and in particular, you will have strong scripting and Linux experience. This is a great opportunity to join a growing organisation and be part of a great team.
 Responsibilities

Building and automating on application build, release, configuration management and deployment over both on-prem and cloud based infrastructure.
Work as DevOps Engineer as a part of scrum teams on software delivery projects.
Act as a technical escalation and provide L2/L3 for customer support requests.
Monitor, respond and report on environment (application, platform & infrastructure) metrics in accordance with agreed customer SLAs for availability, performance and capacity.
Be part of the on-call support team to perform releases, ad-hoc service requests and incident recovery during out of hours and public holidays.
Developing infrastructure as a code (IaC) via scripting, automation, CI/CD pipelines, orchestration.

About You
 We are looking for a highly capable and technically hands on experience DevOps Developer. You will also have:

Hands-on experience on AWS and/or Azure design, implementation, optimization, and support of cloud infrastructure.
Linux and Windows sysadmin skills, scripting with Perl / Python / PowerShell, integration with IaC. 
Demonstrable advanced application debugging (Microsoft IIS .NET technology stack) and troubleshooting skills.
Experience in incident, problem, capacity and change management (ITIL desirable) and ability to maintain technical documentation and CI records in accordance with changes made.
Good communication, coordination and interpersonal skills, and ability to work with internal / external stakeholders spreading in different time zones and geographical locations.

Your Benefits
 At Civica we believe our people are our biggest asset and we pride ourselves on cultivating a supportive and modern working environment; whilst providing you with the tools you need to get the job done. We will offer what you would expect in today’s modern work environments:

Join a growing and successful business
Flexible working conditions
Genuine career development

Civica is a Diversity Leader
 At Civica we are committed to building and maintaining an inclusive and supportive culture where diversity thrives, and all of our people excel. We believe that diversity stimulates innovation, enables us to deliver better outcomes for people and communities, supports the growth of our people, and delivers great results for our customers. At Civica we recruit, promote and reward our people based on their contribution, regardless of gender, race, disability, religion/belief, nationality, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age or marital status.
 What Next?
 Do we sound like a good match? If so then we would love to hear from you! Please include a cover letter outlining how your experience, aspirations and values are a match, along with your resume and we will take it from there.
 Civica is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all sections of the community.

About the job 




     The Red Hat Australia and New Zealand (ANZ) Consultancy team is looking for a Senior DevOps Architect to join our Global Professional Services practice in Australia. In this role, you will help us ensure that our engagements are not just a technology implementation, but an organizational transformation. You'll focus on technology and people and processes, enabling them through a residency-style engagement in which consulting engineers work together with customers in small teams to build, test, and iterate over innovative application prototypes attached to real business value.
    

 As a Senior DevOps Architect, you will serve as the lead architect in our lab engagements, co-creating innovative software solutions using emerging open source technology and modern software design methods in an agile environment. You'll support everything from the scoping of Labs residencies to delivering the engagements. This role ideally suits a senior, directly involved architect with the passion for coaching teams, design, communication, and delivering complex solutions.
    



What you will do 




Lead the discovery, architecture, design, and implementation of application prototypes using modern application development practices and emerging open source technologies with Kubernetes and OpenShift
 Write cloud-native code and automated tests in Java using modern frameworks like Quarkus
 Implement continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines with container-based solutions and GitOps
 Solve complex issues in production and non-production applications, clusters, and operating systems
 Work as a trusted advisor to our customers, guide them through solutions that directly translate into business value and outcomes
 Support pre and post-sales field teams during workshops, proofs of concepts, pilots, and production deployments




What you will bring 




8+ years of experience working as a software developer, architect, or in other similar technical and consulting roles
 Ability to perform customer-facing activities in fast-paced as well as more constrained environments
 Practical experience in software development and testing with languages like Java, Go, and Python
 End-to-end knowledge of the software delivery process, from design, build, test, security, all the way to apps running in production
 Enthusiasm for working with container platforms, CD, and automation
 Passion for DevOps and other ways of working that enable business agility and fast delivery
 Experience facilitating software design, architecture, and ideation sessions
 Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills
 Willingness to travel up to 15% of the time to customer locations throughout ANZ and globally on occasion following Red Hat’s COVID-19 guidelines


 #LI-REMOTE #LI-VH1





About Red Hat 




     Red Hat is the world’s leading provider of enterprise open source software solutions, using a community-powered approach to deliver reliable and high-performing Linux, hybrid cloud, container, and Kubernetes technologies. Red Hat helps customers integrate new and existing IT applications, develop cloud-native applications, standardize on our industry-leading operating system, and automate, secure, and manage complex environments. Award-winning support, training, and consulting services make Red Hat a trusted adviser to the Fortune 500. As a strategic partner to cloud providers, system integrators, application vendors, customers, and open source communities, Red Hat can help organizations prepare for the digital future.

job_title: Automation & Devops Code Camp - Expression of Interest
job_summary:
Automation & Devops Code Camp - Expression of Interest Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Canberra & Adelaide, . · Information Technology
 


    AccessHQ, a Dialog Group Company, will be running our Automation & DevOps Code Camps in the following locations: 
   
Adelaide
Brisbane
Canberra
Sydney
Melbourne 
Our Code Camps area a free training program, after which successful participants will be offered a full-time, 
   entry-level role in our Automation & DevOps team. Here’s what one of the previous participants had to say about the experience:
   

"Soon after the code camp started, I realized that it's a privilege to be trained here. The trainer is extremely knowledgeable, a great teacher and a very kind person. The subjects he taught us in a span of less than one week left me in awe. I am ten times more confident in coding than I was a week back. Every technique he taught us is backed by simple logic and is fail proof. I am extremely grateful to him and AccessHQ for giving me this opportunity to learn Automation in an efficient manner."


What is the Code Camp?
 The Code Camp is a free hands-on training and recruitment program with a unique opportunity to receive instruction and demonstrations, participate in hands-on coding workshops and receive reviews, feedback and advice from an industry expert with over 20 years' experience.
   

What will you learn?
 Some of the topics being covered are: 
   
The DevOps and Quality lifecycle
SCM and version control using GIT
Using developer tools to inspect and debug
Unit Testing concepts and tools
Automation of UI (Selenium WebDriver, Puppeteer etc.) and Web Service tests
Design patterns and clean coding concepts
CI/CD automated test execution
Docker and container-based apps and infrastructure
… and more!


Who are AccessHQ?
 AccessHQ is a wholly owned subsidiary of the Dialog Group of companies and has over 20 years' experience in the assurance and testing space and is passionate about making technology live up to its promise. We believe that technology is an enabler for people to work, connect and learn. AccessHQ is the voice of the people who use technology; whether we are customers, students, employees or citizens we're all human and all technology should have Human Quality.
   

Who are we looking for?

People who have focused their studies on software development, or who have an active interest in programming and automation and are able to demonstrate their ability – you must be confident writing OOP code in Java or C#.
People looking for an entry-level role and the support needed to grow your career.
People with analytical minds who think outside the box and solve problems in a creative way.
People who want to ensure that end users get the quality experience they deserve (Human Quality).


Want to apply?
 Register your interest by applying to this job. When we have a Code Camp coming up in your region we will get in touch.
   
 If you’re interested please attach your CV and cover letter to this application, ensure you state which location you’re interested in attending. Use your cover letter to explain why you want the opportunity to participate in our Code Camp. If you have a public Git repository with examples of your work, please provide details in your CV or cover letter so we can view your code.
   
 If you want more information on us go to www.accesshq.com/careers.

At Objective we create that software that makes a difference. With over 400 people and 5 development labs spread across Australia, New Zealand, the United States of America and the United Kingdom, Objective is a leading developer of GovTech software.
   


 About the role



 Our solutions underpin the public, financial and insurance sector effectiveness; efficiency and transparency by helping deliver better services to the community at a lower cost. Through direct customer engagement, Objective is committed to delivering outcomes that have a positive effect on the public sector, its citizens and the community.
   


 Our culture is reflected through our talented and committed team of professionals. It is our people who are paramount to driving our ongoing success.
   


 The DevOps role brings leadership and the technical skills required to our cloud and development operations to our hosted products; Keystone, Connect, Redact, Trapeze, Alpha, RegWorks and REACH. The role works closely with each of the product development teams, bringing an “automation first” focus to ensuring our CI/CD tools, processes and methods are enabling Objective to deliver world class Cloud services.
   




 What your day will look like


 Develop automation and processes to enable the team to deploy, manage, configure, scale and monitor their applications in the cloud
 Write scripts, building infrastructure as code, work with immutable “cloud” based environments
 Actively participate in high level team activities such as suggesting process improvements
 System troubleshooting and problem solving across platform and application domains
 Expected to participate in on-call escalations to troubleshoot customer facing issues
 Proactively take ownership of issues, pushing them through to resolution
 Be an advocate for a DevOps culture within our Operations and Product Development teams
 Provide support (coaching and mentoring) for junior teammate's work activities






 What we are looking for 


Practical Linux based systems administration skills and scripting experience in a Cloud based environment
 Experience with source control and build systems
 Experience with at least one automated deployment tool (Chef, Ansible or Puppet experience will be highly regarded)
 CI/CD (Continuous Integration/Deployment) experience with a deployment automation and configuration management tools (gitlab, Jenkins, Bamboo, etc)
 Experience in cloud administration, especially with a public cloud provider (preferably AWS)
 Experience building infrastructure as code (e.g. AWS CloudFormation, Azure Templates, Terraform)
 Ability to write and understand scripts (python, ruby, go, etc)
 Experience with common open source monitoring (such as Prometheus, Nagios, Cacti, Graphite, Munin, etc) will be highly regarded
 Working knowledge of SQL
 Working knowledge of Docker and containers
 Working knowledge of Java application deployment






     Think you’d love the role but don’t tick all the boxes? We’d encourage you to apply anyway, we’re always keen to meet like-minded people.
   

     We recruit the best and brightest people in the industry who are passionate about their work. We aim to create an environment that allows talented people to deliver innovative technical solutions. We offer a truly flexible working environment. Come and join a team that is making a difference.

As Cloud Devops Lead, you will have primary responsibility on operations engineering to deliver ongoing operational and business initiative outcomes. You will be providing DevOps technical expertise to support your team and other IT product teams to deliver services and changes across the company’s IT ecosystem, which includes third-party cloud hosted IT platforms, in-house managed cloud, and local data centre IT platforms.
 This key responsibilities for this role are as follows:

Provide technical leadership and clear context to engineers at all levels across internal and external product squad
Assume technical accountability for successful implementation of changes.
Responsible for ensuring engineering standards and best practices are being followed, promoting timely feedback, automation, and focus on value delivery.
Produce, contribute, and maintain technical designs, be an expert of IT products under your team’s remit.
Assess and manage technical risks, ensuring the non-functional requirements are being captured and met.
Be hands-on the tools and collaborate with multiple product squads to deliver collective outcomes, covering the following:

✓ Implement platform provisioning and maintenance solutions, e.g., setting up cloud platform resources, middleware configuration, databases, etc.
 ✓ Implement release engineering solutions, e.g., setting up release pipeline, release notes, application deployment, etc.
 ✓ Implement operational workflow and orchestration solutions, e.g., job scheduling, file
 transfer, etc.
 ✓ Implement business continuity solutions, e.g., monitoring, backup, recovery, etc.
 ✓ Implement workforce computing solutions, e.g., provisioning end user computing resourcing, identity & access management, etc.
 ✓ Implement operations automation using configuration and orchestration toolsets, as well as
 scripting frameworks.

Triage and undertake root-cause analysis of support incidents and issues.
Assist your team in tracking application issues and provide clear feedback on potential changes or improvements where applicable.
Identify, analyse, and support resolution of application issues with internal and external parties.
Support technical work breakdown, estimation, and assignment.
Coach product team members on all technical matters to achieve team outcomes.
Drive towards the realization of the technical vision of the IT products that are being built, ensuring alignment to enterprise quality assurance and governance practices, be an advocate of DevSecOps practices.
Develop good understanding of the company’s IT ecosystem.
Collaborate with product owner, capability leads and team members to develop solutions that are fit for purpose and align to the enterprise intelligent operations strategy.
Contribute to design of operations enablement capabilities, and continuous improvement of them.
Stay on top of relevant industry best practices and trends, as well as changes to compliance requirements.

To be considered for this role you need the following skills/experience:

5+ years of experience in Technical Lead role targeted at the cloud, preferably Azure.
Solid experience with various DevOps concept, tools, and technologies.
Solid experience of CI/CD and related toolsets, good exposure to Azure DevOps.
Solid experience with cloud infrastructure setup and Infrastructure as Code (IAC).
Solid experience with operations integrations (e.g., system integrations via API, file transfer, etc.).
Solid experience in Agile framework supporting CI/CD processes.
Good experience with infrastructure and network management (e.g., system patching, middleware upgrade, monitoring, etc.)
Good experience with local data centre resource management and setup.
Good understanding of security and vulnerability management (e.g., firewall configuration, endpoint upgrade, security patching, etc).
Industry / business knowledge of the Australian Insurance market (preferably with experience of General Insurance) is highly desirable.

This role offers an ambitious and proven Cloud DevOps Lead, the opportunity to join an innovative cloud environment working within the Insurance sector in Australia and really make an impact through their own technical understanding and ability.
 To learn more about this exciting new role please contact Sahar Khalid on 0421 869 643 or to apply please send your resume to email – [email protected]marsrecruitment.com.au

Working at Atlassian



 Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company.



 With a sufficient timezone overlap with the team, we're able to hire eligible candidates for this role from any location in Australia and New Zealand. If this sparks your interest, apply today and chat with our friendly Recruitment team.
  

    Your future team
  

    Atlassian is searching for a Lead Researcher to join our growing team of research experts. Atlassian's mission is to unleash the potential of teams all over the world. You will define and conduct research that not only informs our ultimate mission, but that feeds the design, strategy and development or our products. You'll join a smart and passionate team of mixed-methods researchers, spread across the globe. We work together to improve our craft as researchers and our ability to support Atlassian to build better experiences for our customers and users.
  



What you'll do


 You will report to the Agile & DevOps Research Manager and will make impact on a huge scale: we're searching for someone to help us identify and understanding questions we need to answer to move product strategy forward. Your insights and discoveries will help inform not only our company strategy, but also our product experiences and long-term roadmaps.
 You will partner with partners across product management, design, marketing, data science, and engineering to influence product design and direction.
 You will conduct end-to-end research using a variety of methodologies, to help us better understand our users (current and future), their needs, and the opportunity this uncovers for our products.
 You'll be empowered to work with autonomy and creativity every step of the way, working with your team and partners to determine where the greatest impact can be made, and to triage research requests.
 As a Lead Researcher, you will provide craft expertise, modelling high-quality craft practices and contributing to the development of an experienced research practice across Atlassian.






Your background


 7+ years of hands-on experience designing and conducting user research that has had an impact. We expect to hear stories of how your research influenced product roadmaps and informed design decisions.
 You'll be experienced with a variety of qualitative and quantitative research techniques (remote and in-person), along with the knowledge of when, why and how to apply them. We value your ability to be creative when thinking about the research problem you're trying to solve, and your ability to bring your team along on the journey of your discoveries.
 You know how to analyse qualitative data, synthesize into a coherent and truthful story, and how to create effective ways of sharing your insights so they resonate and are impactful across diverse audiences, including senior leadership.
 An ability to design and execute high quality mixed-methods (qual and quant) research, and to synthezise results across multiple methods.






It is great if you also have


    Professional experience in applied product research, with experience your research being presented to influence product design and direction.
  

    A qualification in behavioural or social sciences, such as psychology, anthropology, sociology, human factors or a related subject area.
  


 Our perks & benefits



 To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more.
  


 About Atlassian



 The world’s best teams work better together with Atlassian. From medicine and space travel, to disaster response and pizza deliveries, Atlassian software products help teams all over the planet. At Atlassian, we're motivated by a common goal: to unleash the potential of every team.
  


 We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians create our success. To ensure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience, we never discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
  


 To learn more about our culture and hiring process, explore our Candidate Resource Hub.

DevOps Engineer

   You will know the development life cycle better than the back of your hand including Agile methodologies.

Experience with docker clustering frameworks like, Kubernetes, Docker Swarm, ...etc.
Experience in building and maintaining existing pipelines, including, but not limited to, TeamCity, Octopus Deploy, SonarQube, NuGet Server, NPM repository, Artifactory ...etc.

Experience with APM tools like App Dynamics, ability to manage and maintain system configurations.

Experience with Azure/GCP and AWS.
Experience in automation of performance testing.

Working conditions:




Occasional out of hour's conferencing with overseas colleagues.
Occasional out of hours or weekend work.
A workplace that supports & role models Diversity & Inclusion. This is a huge part of who we are and what Kindred stands for.
Learning & Development to assist you achieve your career goals.
Fast paced agile environment, with leading edge technology and innovation.
Work in a collaborative environment with highly talented and motivated colleagues that are passionate about knowledge sharing.




 Functional Skills:




Ability to cope with competing demands and remain focused with competing priorities.
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to communicate with impact.
Excellent time management and organisational skills.
Ability to relate to employees at all levels of the organisation.
Ability to gain co-operation and commitment.
People focus.

WHO WE ARE
Tealium is the most trusted and world’s largest independent customer data platform. Tealium connects customer data – spanning web, mobile, offline, and IoT devices — so brands can connect with their customers. Tealium’s turnkey integration ecosystem supports more than 1,300 client-side and server-side vendors and technologies, empowering brands to create a unified, real-time customer data infrastructure.
Tealium’s customer data solutions encompass tag management, an API hub, a customer data platform with machine learning and AI, and data management solutions that make customer data more valuable, actionable, and secure. Tealium has been a trusted provider of customer data solutions for more than a decade, and more than 850 top businesses worldwide including Microsoft, Hyatt, Gap, HSBC and Novartis rely on Tealium to power their customer data strategies.
Team Tealium works and lives across the U.S. and in nearly 20 countries across the world. We are intentional about our culture, our investment in our team members and how we care and connect.
Tealium = Teal + Helium. Teal: a vibrant reflection that evokes authenticity, trustworthiness, reliability, open communication and clarity of thought. Helium: we rise above, a kinetic force that elevates our customers’ and our experiences beyond all others.
We win together with respect and appreciation for the talents required of all positions and the people who contribute to each of these.
We are looking for a highly motivated Australia based SRE and Dev Ops Engineer to run, improve and scale our global AWS production infrastructure including global production deployments. Troubleshooting issues with regional customers teaming with Customer Success Enhance and extend production infrastructure performance and scalability. Assist with our Production migration to EKS/Kubernetes.

WHY YOU ARE THE PERFECT FIT

5+ years’ experience with CICD technologies (Jenkins, ArgoCD, Artifactory, Containerization preferred)

 You will provide in-depth knowledge and expert advice on complex issues related to Agile ways of working, working across a broad range of activities, different program areas and stakeholders. Key responsibilities include:

Implementing and refining agile / product management principles and practices and establishing process metrics to measure progress effectiveness
Working closely with product teams and assisting in the adoption of new ways of working, providing coaching and guidance when needed
Maintaining and improving the Agile tracking tool and assisting product line teams in navigating agile tools and software
Building and maintaining productive working relationships with key stakeholders
Facilitating Agile meetings, and workshops
Initiating an agile adoption roadmap and monitoring progress for product teams based on their level of maturity
Drive the design and continuous improvement of agile ways of working for each product line
Proactively building productive working relationships with both digital and business teams and coaching and empowering product teams to achieve proficiency in agile practices

The successful candidate will be accountable for delivering agreed outcomes, and providing professional advice and support on standards, programs, and/or processes. You will also be a key contributor to the Library’s journey to improve the Agile practices continuously. You will provide in-depth knowledge and expert advice, and direction on complex process improvement.
 Requirements

5+ years of experience coaching teams of various sizes to adopt Agile practices with demonstrable fluency
Extensive experience working as an Agile coach or Scrum master on software development projects / teams
Extensive experience with administrating and configuring Agile tool like Jira
Strong communication and problem-solving skills
Strong training / coaching skills
Sound knowledge with SDLC
Interpersonal, relationship-building skills and patience

Desirable

Experience working with CI / CD tools such as Jenkins
Experience in DevOps and automation
Experience in Digital Product Management

Eligibility
 Applicants should hold qualifications or equivalent extensive experience in information technology or related field and have experience in an applications development environment.
 The classification offered will depend on the successful applicant's experience.

Login to an existing account or reset your password

We are MYOB


    MYOB is the #originalstartup. Our roots are in finance and accounting software, but today we’re so much more! We’re building a business management platform to help more businesses in Australia & New Zealand Start, Survive & Succeed. Our team is continually transforming, inventing and disrupting conventions. We don’t want you to simply ‘fit’ into our already established culture, we want you to add to it, and make it even better! This is MYOB.
  


 About the role:


    The role of the DevOps Engineer is to ensure the production environments are stable, impactful, and secure by working collaboratively with the development team members and providing support to MYOB’s employees and collaborators.
  

    To be successful in this role, a DevOps engineer requires flexibility and a willingness to tackle new challenges; therefore, driving MYOB outcomes where the business redirects its resourcing is crucial.
  


 Have a DevOps “Build it, run it” attitude, understanding both development and operations. The role is around 65% back-end and 35% front-end.
  



What will you bring:


 3 -5 years experience as a developer working in a team environment, with 2+ years in an agile, large-scale, commercial environment.
 Demonstrable involvement or engagement with the software engineering and development community.
 Exposure to one of the critical public cloud offerings, ideally AWS services such as AWS EC2, AWS RDS, ELB, Route 53, S3, CloudWatch, Lambda, SNS, SES, etc. 
Practical experience in Node.js, Typescript, React, and Unit Tests.
 Experience creating and consuming REST APIs.
 Containerization (Docker/Kubernetes) and infrastructure as code skills (Ansible, Terraform, or similar.)
 Solid understanding of test labs and virtualized environments.
 Practical experience scaling build and deployment systems through on-premises and cloud environments
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
 Bonus: Experience administering continuous integration (CI/CD) systems such as Jenkins, Teamcity, Buildkite, or similar.






Our Culture & Benefits


    Our values have stood the test of time. If you want to work and collaborate where opinions are valued, and your ideas can make a difference, come to a place where Your Work Matters.
  

Do your best work in a flexible work environment, right down to financial assistance to set up your home office…it’s called Flexperience, and it’s designed by you and your team!
Our partnership with Smiling Mind helps support the wellbeing of our team members and customers
Drive your own learning via conferences, in-house training, LinkedIn Learning, study assistance and a strong focus on leaders creating a learning environment
A multitude of leave options including up to an additional four weeks of purchased leave, generous parental leave, domestic violence leave, transgender leave, volunteer leave, study leave, plus more!
Communities built around ‘Wellness’, ‘Belonging’ and the ‘Planet’ where you can make a meaningful contribution
Access to best-in-class discounts and vouchers from leading retailers, and a lot more.



 We are proud to be a Circle Back Initiative Employer and we commit to responding to every applicant.
  


 MYOB are an equal opportunity employer and we champion diversity. Don’t meet every single requirement of this role? Still apply! Research tells us that that women and underrepresented groups are less likely to apply unless they meet every single requirement. At MYOB we believe that the right hire is someone who makes an addition to our culture, rather than someone who fits in and conforms to our status quo. Moving to ‘Culture Add’ means adding team members who not only value MYOBs standards and workplace culture, but also bring an aspect of diversity that positively contributes to MYOB. So, if you’re excited about this role, or about MYOB, we’d still love to hear from you!

 Bring your enthusiasm and creativity to our team and help us improve our Linux Server platform and drive innovation. We require you to have strong Linux Redhat skills with a DevOps mindset.
 You will support our on-premise environment but will also be front and centre for helping us transform our environment to the Public and Private Cloud platforms.
 You value innovation, automation and diversity and will use these throughout your work to help us enhance and accelerate the capabilities we deliver to our business.
 Your technical capabilities will include:

strong knowledge of UNIX (Redhat)

exposure to public and private cloud platforms
experience working in a high-paced, ever-changing environment
a passion for automation, self-service and creating ways to enable and empower our customers
strong problem-solving skills with a focus on business outcomes, specifically in a global and dynamic business environment
highly collaborative and driven to deliver outstanding solutions.

We need someone who has a wealth of previous experience in building and supporting enterprise class installations. About Kasada



 Join us in stopping bad bots, for good! Kasada protects millions of online users everyday. Founded to stop automated bot attacks, we believe the internet should be a safe place for everyone. Bad bots are highly destructive. They take over accounts, steal content, overload systems and infrastructure and cause billions of dollars in damages every year. Seeking to restore trust in the internet, Kasada stops bots at the very first request including those that have never been seen before.
 


 We’ve grown from a few friends working out of a shipping container under the Sydney Harbour Bridge to now operating globally, we’re spread across the world protecting some of the most well-known brands on the face of the earth.
 


 We’re an innately curious team that’s not afraid to bring bold ideas to create better ways of solving problems. We’re looking for people who are passionate about solving some of the most difficult and pressing cybersecurity issues, while having fun doing it!
 


 We are looking for a Senior DevOps Engineer who wants to make their mark on how we manage large deployments that handle upwards of 100,000 requests per second (scaling from hundreds to thousands of containers!). This role is a key enabler in helping us achieve this vision.
 


 You'll find yourself deploying new services on Kubernetes, empowering developers to diagnose issues by improving monitoring, and automating the odd manual process to reduce the friction experienced across our engineering teams.
 


 This role can be remote anywhere in Australia. We have offices in Sydney and Melbourne if you'd like to work from an office. Whatever works best for you!
 
 What you'll bring 

Strong automation focus, you want to automate everything
 Deep knowledge of deploying applications on AWS, configuring EC2, load balancers, auto scaling groups, IAM and Security Groups
 A familiarity with security and compliance tools like AWS Control Tower, AWS Security Hub, AWS Config, and AWS Cloud Trail is a plus (but not essential)
 Experience with infrastructure as code with technologies - at least one of Pulumi, Terraform or CloudFormation.
 Experience with application monitoring tools such as Prometheus/Grafana
 Experience operating Kubernetes clusters and migrating containerised workloads to Kubernetes
 Solid networking skills (familiarity with VPCs, VPC Peering and Transit Gateway a plus)
 Pragmatic and considered approach


   This is not intended to be a laundry list, we do
   not expect you to be an expert in everything, but we do expect you to be passionate about learning new technologies you are less familiar with
 
 What you'll be doing

 Automating all the things
 Optimizing the infrastructure of our market leading bot mitigation product
 Working in our awesome infra team, and promoting and driving a strong devops culture across our engineering teams
 Identify and propose automation improvements in our workflows
 Improving our CI/CD pipelines with automation and infrastructure as code
 Defining best practices and guidelines for services and systems from CI/CD through deployment in production



 The Benefits of being a Kasadian



 We want to ensure Kasada remains a great place to work and a place to do great work. It's important to us to build an inclusive environment where you can realize your full potential. We are a highly collaborative team regardless of location, placing a strong emphasis on our core values; and we have designed our benefits package so you can thrive, both inside and outside of work:
 


 A stake in Kasada’s global success with equity/stock options


   - Flexible working hours and arrangements - Create a schedule that suits you
 

   - Support for growing families - Generous parental leave allowances and return to work coaching
 

   - Resources for well-being to support your growth including our EAP - confidential counseling for you and your loved ones
 

An action packed calendar of fun in-person and virtual events
New Macbooks for all!


   - Pet friendly offices - We love all Kasadians, whether they have two, four, or more legs!
 


 Sound interesting? What’s next?



 Hit the apply button and one of our team will set up an exploratory, confidential discussion. We have designed our hiring process to be streamlined and thorough so everyone can make the right call on whether it is the right move for you. We are an inclusive team and this extends to all candidates that interview with us. Interviews are conducted virtually however if you want to come onsite - just ask! When you apply, please tell us the pronouns you use and any adjustments you may need during the interview process, we want to ensure you are set up for success in every conversation.
 


 Still with us? Just a little bit more…



 Research shows that women and other marginalized individuals tend to only apply when they check every box. We’re always keen to broaden our perspective, so if you think you have what it takes, but don't necessarily meet every single point above, please still get in touch, we'd love to have a chat and see if you could be a great addition to the team!

DevOps Engineer

Location: Melbourne/Sydney
Reporting to: DevOps & Cloud Services

Job requirements
 Are you a skilled DevOps Engineer looking for an opportunity to accelerate your career in an exciting role that balances role balances exceptional people, hands-on work and diverse, current projects?
 This is a high-visibility, high-impact role where you’ll gain experience and exposure across teams. You’ll work directly on the cutting-edge core platform, with a key focus on improving its speed, reliability and efficiency. You’ll have the chance to influence key technical choices and the technology used to automate development and deployment processes in a CI/CD environment.
 Requirements

You have production AWS cloud technology deployments experience (with solid understanding of security best practices)
You have experience with production monitoring and alerting of microservice-based environments
You’re a Linux expert and have knowledge of associated scripting languages; Python, Bash, PowerShell
You have working knowledge of load balancing and HTTP services, plus high-availability clustering solutions
You have experience with some (or all) of the following technologies: Kubernetes, Terraform, Ansible, CloudFormation, CI/CD tools, Jenkins, Octopus, ELK, CloudWatch, Prometheus, Grafana
You’re a proactive communicator who enjoys working collaboratively in a complex technical environment

As a Senior Technical Engineer, you will be providing support to our clients and our business owners for a suite of products in the Structured Finance space. This position requires a problem-solving mindset to be able to find solutions in a variety of different products and technologies. In this role, you will be a trusted technical advisor to our product owners and developers. This position requires knowledge in multiple technologies, and we will provide training for the right fit.
 In detail, you will:

 Provide technical support for multiple applications written using multiple technologies.
 Handle JSM & internal Jira ticketing systems.
 Provide support to clients during installation & upgrade of applications both internally & on client premises
 Perform DevOps tasks like monitoring server resources like disk space, cpu/memory and taking corrective actions, start/stop AWS instances, handle deployment tasks, tackle the problems with SSO service or ELB.
 Provide solutions and/or workarounds to resolve complex technical application issues
 Review logs, query Mongo/Postgres databases, read/debug code to identify the root cause
 Investigate root cause of errors in SQL and/or C# layers through various debugging techniques
 Document resolutions, build and maintain knowledge base
 Chip in to in-sprint development activities in C#/SQL technologies
 Collaborate with multi-functional teams across the company (including Business, DevOps, DEV & QA) while shepherding tickets reported by customers
 Learn new tools/technologies involved in the ecosystem




 3+ years of experience in technical support or professional software development.
 Possess DevOps knowledge including installation/deployment/maintenance activities of software applications
 Experience with a Windows-based OS a must.
 Strong experience in DevOps area supporting heterogeneous apps based on different tech stacks.
 Working experience with containerized applications a must.
 Experience supporting relational database servers like MS SQL a must.
 Experience supporting Oracle database server a plus.
 Experience supporting WEB based application a must.
 Experience supporting the applications based on .NET Core a big plus.
 Experience analyzing/debugging C#/JavaScript based application code a big plus.
 Experience with AWS, Jenkins a big plus.
 Experience using Jira Service Desk.
 Exposure to SSO services, ELB.
 Ability to run multiple urgent issues in parallel.
 Technical curiosity and desire to learn new technologies and products.

job_summary:
About HCF 
At HCF, our purpose is to bring our human touch to healthcare. Since 1932 we’ve been putting our members and their health first. As Australia’s largest not-for-profit health fund, we cover over 1.7 million members with health, life, travel and pet insurance and our vision is to make healthcare understandable, affordable, high quality and member centric.
 HCF is embarking on a 3-year transformation journey designed to fast track our 2025 strategic objectives. The Accelerated Transformation Program is responsible for delivering initiatives spanning business and technology teams leveraging agile practices to deliver exceptional member, employee and partner experiences and outcomes. 
About the role
 HCF Australia is undertaking a series of strategic initiatives to deliver new business capabilities to meet its member first strategic plan. These initiatives include leveraging a set of new HCF’s core IT systems and implementing digital capabilities to deliver an enhanced customer experience. The Integration Services team is key to this change by designing, developing, implementing and managing a standardised integration layer between HCF systems to facilitate the seamless exchange of data and services between HCF IT systems, and HCF’s partners. This role will report to the Group Integration Manager.
 Please note this position is a max term position up to 24 months. There are multiple vacancies in this role.
 Responsibilities:

Engages with business users, technical analysts, solution architects and developers to understand needs and requirements for projects and support the continuous development/deployment/testing tasks
Manage the implementations of new systems and infrastructure through planning, config, build & deployment
Identify and automate points of manual work when onboarding new systems and products.
Maintain existing integration and delivery pipelines and ensure processes are standardised and reused.
Maintain, configure and develop dynamic containerised environments in support of development and production. This ranges from greenfield serverless environments to full stack brownfield environments.
Reduce the time it takes to build, deploy, and configure software to all environments.
Joint owner of all development and release tooling, processes and architecture.
Assists in developing application monitoring solutions across cloud and on-prem solutions.
Collaborate with the test team to continue improving testing methods, practices, and capabilities.
Work with development and operations teams to offer automation as a service across domains, products and services.
Conducts unit testing, support during system testing and implementation activities for difficult and complex programs
Challenges existing processes and practices to continuously drive efficiencies and technology delivery performance



 About you:
 To be successful in the role you will have the following:

The position requires appropriate tertiary qualifications and experience in manual and automated testing.
Minimum 3 years DevOps & Automation experience
Familiarity with Linux commands and DevOps scripts.
Familiar with containerisation, including Docker, Kubernetes
Proven experience of deployment & release management
Solid understanding of testing environments and migration paths
Proven experience of Integration platform tools (such as MuleSoft, TIBCO, IBM, Oracle, Azure Integration Services and AWS API Gateway / Lambda)
Extensive knowledge of SDLC and CICD processes
Experience in understanding the needs from technical as well as end user perspective and then defining positive and negative test cases around it.
Experience with CI/CD frameworks like TFS or Azure DevOps Pipelines.
Experience in developing and maintaining automated test framework and scripts
Experience with API testing.
Experience with performance/benchmark/soak testing using tools like Load Runner and JMeter.
Proficient in programming languages such as JavaScript, Powershell, Java, C#
Cloud experience with Azure DevOps (ADO) is desirable
Experience in Agile development methodology/Scrum is preferred
Experience with full lifecycle of a project including business & Customer requirement gathering, workshop facilitation throughout the successful delivery of each piece of work.
Demonstrated track record of delivering excellent and high-quality technical documentations and drawings.
Excellent interpersonal skills, with a focus on effective client relationships

Culture 
Working in the health insurance industry, we know how important it is to prioritise the wellbeing of our own people. We want to provide you with the skills and tools you need to support your wellbeing journey, so that you can be at your best.
 We’re all about creating a fantastic people experience, guided by our values, so that we can in turn better deliver for our members. We work with our people to create a work experience that is inclusive, supportive, safe and respectful so we can do the best for our members.
 Come and join our HCF team!
 Benefits 

Up to 50% discount on health cover, pet & travel insurance
Family & Friends day
Organisational wide Recognition & Rewards program
Health & Wellbeing Initiatives



 A career with us – How to Apply 
Please check out our website at https://www.hcf.com.au/about-us/careers

 About Us
 At Beacon Lighting, our reputation as Australia’s leading lighting specialist comes from our comprehensive range of the very latest lighting styles, trends and innovations and the most up to date designs. For us, lighting is not just about the flick of a switch, it influences the way we feel, work and live. Trading for over 50 years now, Beacon Lighting is a household name and a stable company that continues to successfully grow the business.

 The Role
 This role will be responsible for the maintenance, monitoring, development and implementation of the core infrastructure system and networks and digital security portfolio within the company to ensure stable and secure operation.

 Key responsibilities include:

 Administer and maintain the company’s IT infrastructure components including Cloud services, Hyper-V/VMware Clusters, Enterprise Storage, O365, AD Services, Citrix, MS Exchange, Domain-SSL and other core platforms.
 Manage and support the company’s network infrastructure, including MPLS, SD-WAN, firewall rules, VPN solutions, wireless security, and FTP Connections
 Maintaining the availability and performance of systems and software, inclusive of virtual and physical infrastructure in data centre environment to ensure optimum systems performance and highlight potential issue.
 Implement and maintain stores’ broadband services and network devices with good coverage of IOT products
 Providing escalated 2nd and 3rd level technical support, troubleshooting and fault rectification of issues relating to Infrastructure & Web services
 Documenting detailed system configuration for the purpose of quality, transparency, knowledge transfer and business continuity.
 A strong focus on customer service and maintaining a high level of customer satisfaction.
 Disaster recovery portfolio with all core system within the group
 Providing after-hours IT support to the business

 About You
 To be successful in this role you will possess the following attributes:

 Previous experience in a similar role, working with third-party service providers
 Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Server Infrastructure, including Hyper-V/VMware Cluster Management, Active Directory, MS Exchange, Citrix, and Networking topologies
 Experience to support critical infrastructure in data centre environment. Configure and maintain Microsoft technologies, including Microsoft Server Clusters, O365, integration and working knowledge of Microsoft products
 Installation and maintenance of system software tools, operating systems, patching, and application deployment, building and deploying SOE, data protection and specialised utilities
 Good understanding of IT Security, Data protection and Cloud-based environment (IaaS/PaaS/SaaS)
 Disaster recovery planning and processes
 Knowledge of windows programming and DevOps techniques
 Strong communication skills, with the ability to translate complex technology topics into layperson terms
 Project Management experience
 Pragmatic, result-oriented and hands-on attitude
 Providing after-hours IT support to the business

 Benefits
 In return for your efforts, we offer an attractive salary package, generous product discounts, and a great supportive team culture. Based in Derrimut, this role also offers flexible working arrangements. This is a fantastic opportunity to work within an ASX listed company that has been constantly evolving and striving for success for over 50 years.

 How to Apply
 If this sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you! Simply click on 'Apply Now' and follow the prompts to complete your application.

Servian is an award-winning, people-focused, global tech consultancy with a rich heritage in Data, DevOps/Cloud, Digital, Machine Learning and Cyber Security. We embrace innovation, change, and the positive impact it has on us and our clients. As a Servianite you will have the opportunity to work on a wide range of interesting projects, using a variety of emerging technologies. We aim to build an employee experience where you will grow more with us, not be drowned out by the loudest voice, and hence we strive to set you up for a career that will have a greater impact.
  


 Our business is focused on developing our people and offerings across the following:


 Cloud & Technology - Cloud Services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform), DevOps and Automation inc HashiCorp
  

 Data & Analytics - BI/DWH, Big Data Analytics, Data Engineering, Data Science and Advanced Analytics (Snowflake)
  

 Digital - Full stack Development, UI/UX Design, Mobile Development
  

 Customer Engagement - Marketing Campaigns, Campaign Analysis, Customer Insights
  

 Artificial Intelligence - Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Deep Learning
  

 Cyber Security - DevSecOps, Penetration Testing, Multi-Cloud Security, Security Posture Analysis
  


 The Role:


    You will be a Senior member of the Melbourne team and connected to the wider Servian leadership. You will be passionate about growing people, keeping abreast of technology and delivering impactful solutions for our DevOps pillar.
  



What To Look Forward To:


 Pre-Sales activity and relationship building with clients and technology partners
 Building accurate estimates and commercial models for advisory and consulting engagements
 Leading the consultants and being accountable for the outcomes of the work delivered. Ensuring consultants are provided with feedback and are supported through their engagements to deliver outcomes to clients and opportunities for personal growth.
 Consulting to clients in the form of strategic recommendations, report writing, analysis and delivery.
 Producing solution architectures and proposals for new projects.
 Presenting to clients and partners on Servian solutions and offerings.
 Workshop facilitation with clients, technology partners and our team.
 Collaborating with a team of like-minded and experienced engineers for Tier 1 to scale up customers, you will focus on core platform engineering on cloud. Your work will have an impact on platforms that handle crores of customers and millions of transactions daily.
 Being hands on when need, you will use the latest cloud services to design and develop reusable core components and frameworks for use by software development teams as well as platform optimisation for security, reliability and scalability. 
You will help drive a DevOps culture, advocate cloud best practices and mentor junior team members around you.






Experience Required For Success: 


Be experienced in DevOps and Automation in Microsoft Azure, AWS and GCP
 Built pipeline (CI) experience; both design and implementation
 Automation and scripting experience
 Have managed timelines and budgets
 Delivered Cloud Adoption Framework and Well Architected Framework principles
 Have great communication skills with stakeholders at all levels (executives to technical)
 Be experienced in consulting to clients in automation and migration strategy and execution
 Experience in Infrastructure as a service (IaaS) and platforms as a service (PaaS).Experience/knowledge in HashiCorp tools (Terraform, Vault, Nomad, Consul).

Looking for an exciting, diverse and challenging new role with a global impact? Join a digital transformation team in Australia's largest professional services firm that delivers technology solutions for our people and clients. 

The Opportunity 

At PwC, we help Australian businesses, not-for-profits and governments create value and improve the way they work. From improving healthcare, to creating smarter cities and igniting Australia’s start up industry, you’ll build trust in society and solve important problems. 

Our Assurance business delivers a broad range of financial audit and risk advisory services. Our teams work with clients to help them protect and strengthen every aspect of their business, from people to performance, strategy to systems, and business plans to business resilience. 

As a leading provider of trust services in a digital world, we are constantly reimagining the way we solve problems for our clients and deliver our work. Our Digital Solutions team injects specialist digital product design and incubation, AI automation and software engineering capabilities into our Assurance business. Our analysts, designers and engineers work in partnership with our audit, data and risk professionals to create next generation digital solutions for our people and clients. 

The Role 

As a DevOps Engineer in the Assurance Digital Solutions team your impact will be seen by: 

Managing large scale Linux + Kubernetes environments for microservices applications and machine-learning workloads. 
Owning the release process within the team and driving continuous delivery for all of our products and environments. 
Identifying opportunities for continuous improvement and conducting technical proof of concepts to test new services and technologies that could be of benefit to our platforms. 
Conducting proactive maintenance and patching to maintain highly available and compliant environments. 
Optimizing system performance, autoscaling and our monitoring/alerting systems to detect issues early and improve reliability. 

About you Applicants must be able to demonstrate the following key capabilities and behaviours: 

You have experience in provisioning, configuring and managing a container orchestration platform 
You have experience in configuring and managing Linux Systems 
You have experience with PostgreSQL databases 
You have had deep experience with a cloud services platform 
In this role you will be working in a highly regulated enterprise environment where you need to collaborate with other remote teams on a daily basis for architecture, operations and compliance. You are security conscious and carry a strong understanding of patch management, certificate management, encryption, platform security and cloud network security. 
You thrive in a culture that has a focus on continuous improvement. You understand the philosophy of DevOps and the role it plays in a fast-moving digital innovation environment. 
You have a devops mindset, understanding what it takes to implement a change and see it through to deployment into multiple environments and all of the challenges that can arise to achieve this.  
Ideally, you will also have: 

Experience with Helm, RabbitMQ and Git 
Experience with Azure DevOps and CI/ CD through it 
Experience with Azure Cloud (AKS, Postgres, Azure Blob Store, Azure Tables, Application Gateway, Application Insights) 
What we offer Working for Australia’s largest professional services firm you’ll join a global network spanning 157 countries that delivers meaningful outcomes for a wide range of clients. Our culture and benefits are why we’re LinkedIn’s number one Australian workplace. With state of the art offices and premium technology, each person has access to flexible work options. The dress policy is flexible too – you choose what you wear based on the work you do with your team and clients. Fostering an inclusive culture and embracing differences is at the core of everything we do. PwC empowers you to be yourself and work with people from many backgrounds to achieve things never thought possible. Get involved in our employee-led diversity networks (cultural, disability, LGBTI or gender equality) and benefit from our best-in-class policies such as 18 weeks maternity/paternity leave, flexible work and gender equity. Up for a challenge? We’re committed to helping our people unleash their potential. Hard work doesn’t go unrewarded and industry best coaching, mentoring, training and development are ready and waiting. If you hold a genuine desire to make a difference and want to surround yourself with like-minded, talented and driven individuals who strive to do the same , apply now . PwC is committed to building and maintaining a diverse workforce. Our Reconciliation Action Plan sets out our commitment to increase Indigenous employment. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Australians. About Netskope
 Today, there's more data and users outside the enterprise than inside, causing the network perimeter as we know it to dissolve. We realized a new perimeter was needed, one that is built in the cloud and follows and protects data wherever it goes, so we started Netskope to redefine Cloud, Network and Data Security.

Since 2012, we have built the market-leading cloud security company and an award-winning culture powered by hundreds of employees spread across offices in Santa Clara, St. Louis, Bangalore, London, Melbourne, and Tokyo. Our core values are openness, honesty, and transparency, and we purposely developed our open desk layouts and large meeting spaces to support and promote partnerships, collaboration, and teamwork. From catered lunches and office celebrations to employee recognition events (pre and hopefully post-Covid) and social professional groups such as the Awesome Women of Netskope (AWON), we strive to keep work fun, supportive and interactive. Visit us at Netskope Careers. Please follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter@Netskope.


 Job Duties
 Netskope's customers include some of the largest Fortune 500 companies that demand best in class customer support. You will be the primary point of contact for dealing with top class IT administrators.
 In this job you will:

Be the primary point of contact for all support and escalations tickets
Be intuitive and inventive by providing solutions and workarounds for customers
Work with Customers, Sales Engineers, Customer Success to report issues to Engineering Team
Regularly communicate status update to Customers
Receive functional, performance and security issues from Customers and promptly follow-up with Engineering and DevOPS
Self-starter with ability to multi-task in a high-pressure, fast-paced, fast growth environment
Write technical notes, application notes, case studies, knowledge base entries, and solutions for the Support Portal
Follow published SLA for turning requests around in a timely manner

Qualifications/Requirements

5+ years of experience in supporting large enterprise customers
Strong TCP/IP knowledge
Excellent knowledge and prior experience supporting network security technologies such as: Proxies, NG Firewalls, SSL/IPSec, VPN's, SSO
Familiarity with DLP and Encryption gateways.
Demonstrable experience with systems installation, configuration and administration of UNIX/Linux and Windows based systems (prior Active Directory/LDAP experience desirable)
Expert in troubleshooting various scenarios and systems by using knowledge of common tools (tcpdump) and protocols (TCP/IP, NTP, DNS, DHCP, etc.).
Familiarity with cloud apps and services
Strong empathy for customers AND passion for revenue and growth
Excellent Communications and Interpersonal Skills required, with a passion for the Cloud and related new technologies.
Prior experience working with Zendesk or other support portal tools

Education:

Bachelors or Masters degree

About the Corporate Operations Group
 The Corporate Operations Group brings together specialist support services in Digital Transformation & Data, Technology, Operations, Human Resources, Business Services, Business Improvement & Strategy, and the Macquarie Group Foundation. We deliver service excellence to ensure Macquarie is open for business, deliver on transformational change, invest in our people and have deep relationships with our customers.
 Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
 The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths, and in combination with our inclusive environment, it enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. From day one, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’ is as inspiring to you as it is to us, please apply.
