About Macquarie

A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.
Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups, disciplines, sectors and borders. With 18,000+ employees and offices in 33 markets around the world, we’re a truly global organisation.
You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives, ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us, you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.
Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.

Come find Your Tomorrow at GBST! We’re a leader in providing technology to the growing financial services industry. With an international profile, and a well established range of products for key market sectors, we are investing heavily in the future of our organisation, our technology and, most importantly, our teams. At GBST you will be part of a team that provides the tools our clients use to manage their customers' money and build their tomorrow.

Job Description

Start your Tomorrow with us!
There has never been a more exciting time to join GBST as we invest heavily in the future of our organisation, our technology and, most importantly, our teams. We are in a state of transformation and, as we evolve, we are excited about what tomorrow will bring. We have a fantastic career opportunity for a Software Engineer to become a central part of our Melbourne team.

Desired Skills and Experience

What you’ll be doing:
Working in a close-knit agile team environment, you’ll provide technical expertise to the project team as we continue our digital transformation and improve existing products.

Build your DevOps skillset and learn the AWS world of CI/CD
Analyse, design and develop new features for our clients using Java/Spring
Work with a broad team on problem resolution, improvements and modifications to our software 
Perform design and code walkthroughs
Undertake code reviews 

We’d love to hear from you if you have:

At least 3 years of development experience in Java/Spring, REST API, and Hibernate
At least 1 year’s development experience in the following tools: 
     
Containerization technology, including Docker and Kubernetes.
Automation tools such as Jenkins, Git
Bash/PowerShell scripting

3+ years of development experience with SQL, XML
Strong analytical and decision-making skills
Ability to work to deadlines and prioritise tasks
Strong communication skills
Flexibility to work as a support person on the roaster
The right to live and work in Australia

 We’d also love it if you have:

Experience with AWS
Maven and Jira experience
Exposure to Web Technologies

 Why choose us?
GBST uses innovative, cutting-edge technologies and architecture such as MicroServices, Domain Driven Design, Micro Frontends, and advanced DevOps practices using Docker, IaC with Terraform, Kubernetes and Helm – and we want to do more. 
GBST is an Australian company that’s been here since 1984. Today, our footprint spans Australia, the UK, Hong Kong, Singapore, Vietnam and the US. We work with over 100 organisations within the investment banking, stockbroking, superannuation and funds management industries to deliver a full range of technology solutions from front-end and digital through to back-office operations.
We are proud of our reputation of providing high-quality, mission-critical solutions for our clients, and our people play a vital role in keeping it.
The world's major financial markets trust their future in our hands every day, so why wouldn't you? Discover your tomorrow at GBST and apply now!

Description:

Job Requisition ID: 30175 

 About the team 

 Our diverse Data & AI team comprises over 500 specialist practitioners across Australia, each of whom is constantly curious and excited about combining their business acumen and technological expertise to create data-centric solutions that help solve complex problems and transform, or reinvent our client’s business. 

 Our Data & AI teamwork with public and private sector clients helps them to design and implement world-leading solutions and capabilities. From solving air and ground transport network issues through our industry-first Optimal Reality digital twin solution, bringing automation capabilities to vaccine rollout programs, to helping our clients move to a sustainable world, we are the partner of choice for our clients and our alliance vendors. 

 Our relationships with market-leading vendors such as AWS, Microsoft, Google, Apple, Snowflake, Salesforce, and Informatica enable our practitioners to be at the forefront of new and emerging capabilities and to deliver our suite of services at scale. We are consistently recognised as leaders in Cloud, Data, Analytics and AI, including in the latest analyst reports. 


As part of this team, you will be responsible for:
 Technical leadership to a team of DevOps engineers 
Leading the design and implementation of cloud-hosted solutions for internal and external clients using tools such as Terraform 
Ensuring security is built into everything we do 
Working with bid teams to estimate and cost solutions for client proposals 
Ensuring services are provided to internal teams and clients to agreed service levels 
Working directly with internal teams and clients to discuss requirements, taking ownership of medium to high complexity technical tasks and providing status updates 
Preparing estimates for technical changes 
Ensuring service governance framework is adhered to (including wiki documentation) 
Identifying technical improvements and upgrades 
Proactively identifying better ways of delivering our services 
Staying current with best practices and identifying ways we can enhance our approach 
Recommending and executing process improvements 
Maintaining environments for internal teams and clients across a range of technologies. 
Designing, implementing and maintaining modular or templated solutions that will be used by a national practice of technical and design teams 

 Enough about us, let’s talk about you. 

 About your experience 

 You have proven experience leading teams in delivering solutions based on Kubernetes, developing and delivering infrastructure automation using tools like Terraform, familiarity with DevOps pipelines and code repository tools like Bitbucket or Github, and an understanding of how to use automation to improve efficiencies in development lifecycles. To be awesome in this role you must have 

 DevOps/Sysadmin experience, in AWS environments 
Prior Production hosting experience with Amazon Web Services 
AWS administration in AWS IAM, Lambda, Cloudwatch, Open Search and Elastic Cache 
Prior experience with AWS API Gateways 
Comfortable using both Windows and Linux environments 
Deploying and managing Kubernetes workloads in AWS highly regarded 
Self-motivated, problem-crushing attitude 
SQL database management or administration 
Understanding of ITIL service delivery lifecycle 

 Why Deloitte? 

 At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. Deloitte Australia opens the door to a career that can cross borders virtually and physically across Asia Pacific to gain experience and access projects beyond Australia’s borders. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in a variety of ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated. 

 We’re committed to continually building a safe and respectful workplace, where all our people feel appreciated and accepted. Through the creation of endorsed employee-led diversity networks which promote cultural, disability, LGBTI+, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and gender equality, we’re leading the way to shape an environment where everybody can thrive. 

 We are proud to have been recognised for our efforts in inspiring change and accelerating progress – check out our careers site for recent recognition in this space.

Deakin’s Digital Services team drives the digital innovation at Deakin. It ensures the University has the technical capabilities, process maturity, and digital project expertise to harness trends like flexibility, mobility, collaboration and personalisation. Our Digital Platforms team is currently seeking to appoint a MuleSoft Integration Developer who will work collaboratively with other teams in Digital Services and key stakeholders in the University to develop and improve business capability by designing integration and interface solutions, on a Mule Enterprise Service Bus (ESB) infrastructure, that supports the enterprise architecture.
 Your key responsibilities will include:

Undertaking and providing advice on configurations, technical designs, development, testing, and upgrades of enterprise integrations built and/or supported by the Applications and Integration team that aligns to all relevant policies and the strategic direction of the University
Providing advice on integration design strategies and contribute to maintaining development coding standards and methodologies, to ensure best practice approaches
Defining, developing, testing and deploying project and operational requirements, including fixes to technical problems, technical specifications, implementation of changes and provision of operational support
Distilling the core issues from complex information, drawing accurate conclusions and condensing complex information and next steps into simple concise terms that others can understand

To be successful, you’ll have: 

A Degree in computing related discipline with subsequent relevant experience; or
Extensive experience and specialist knowledge in integration
Experience with Mulesoft ESB and/or Anypoint Platform development or support
Experience in building integration design patterns and designing, developing and supporting Web Services – SOAP and REST API’s and implementing solutions using Microservice Architectures, Event Driven Architectures and messaging
Experience with DevOps practices such as code versioning, packaging, test driven development (TDD), continuous integration, test automation, code analysis, and code quality metrics
Experience with Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) in large enterprise environment, working with technical teams ideally in an Agile delivery environment
SQL Development and basic query skills

 Successful applicants will need to comply with vaccination mandates imposed by the relevant state/territory government. job_summary:
Build the Next Generation of Fintech products right here in your own backyard 
Be part of a world class team in flexible location in Australia 
Permanent Role 

Our new engineering hub, located on Australia’s Gold Coast – the premier lifestyle location in Australia – is only a couple of hundred metres from one of the most iconic beaches in Australia and the world, Surfers Paradise. This is an Australian first, mixing lifestyle and engineering as a unique employee value proposition in Australia. 
Our hypothesis is, if you provide people great work and an excellent environment combined with a lifestyle, engineers are more likely to join, stay and grow. 
We are reimaging our digital platforms to deliver the best customer experience in the market, and you could be part of a team that is instrumental in delivery cutting edge technology into the hands of millions of our customers. 
The Digital Engineering team is responsible for the technology that is the powerhouse for Consumer Digital Technology. 
How will I help? 
This is a unique and exciting opportunity for a DevOps Lead to play an important role in the development and maintenance of various Digital Products at Westpac. This role is accountable for driving DevOps practices across Consumer Digital Technology, Engineering upliftment through automation, continuous integration, continuous deployment, and continuous measurements and monitoring. 
Core Responsibilities in the role will include – 

Collaborate with team members in a cross-functional team to deliver world-class and high-quality products on the Westpac Digital Platform 
Continuous discovery and implementation of emerging technologies 
Recommend industry best-practices for continuous improvement 
Work closely with other Engineering scrum teams and partner with Product, Project Management, Quality teams 
Lead the diagnosis and resolution of complex service issues to ensure effective development, maintenance, and support of applications 
Provide technical guidance/coaching/mentoring to other engineers 
Review and help team provide proper documentation for solutions and processes 
Implement various build, release, and automation solutions 
In addition to functional, help team to develop and maintain other types of automated testing suites (performance, security/penetration, video, data) 
Contribute to growing the next upcoming talent through our grad and intern Academy 
Contribute and be an advocate to the wider digital tech community through participation in guilds for knowledge sharing and learning 

What’s in it for me? 
You’ll play an important and significant part in the future of a business that has been around for 200 years and be instrumental in achieving our purpose of helping Australians and New Zealanders succeed. So, we’ll back you in the development of your career, with internal career prospects and flexible working. You’ll also be backed by a fantastic team of people in a can-do, supportive structure. 
What do I need? 

Experience with CI/CD tool such as Bamboo, BitBucket, Git, CHEF 
Have a good understanding of the concepts and requirements of DevOps and expert knowledge of designing CI/CD pipelines 
Continuous Build & Release Automation experience 
Working knowledge of languages such as Java and .NET 
Working knowledge of build tools like Gradle and/or Fastlane 
Have a good understanding of security requirements for applications 
Automation testing experience using Selenium 
Advanced analysis, problem solving, troubleshooting and consultative skills 
Experience working with Agile methodology using tools such as JIRA, Confluence etc. 
Be able to estimate the effort needed to build a solution 
Excellent leadership and communication skills 

Nice to have skills: 

Knowledge of languages such as Swift, Kotlin 
Experience with XCode build servers 
Experience using XCUITest (Apple) or Espresso (Android) 
Growth mindset and not afraid of a challenge 

What’s it like to work there? 
As well as good pay and a great culture, joining the Westpac family means you’ll get some of the best banking, wealth and insurance benefits in the market. We back our employees by helping them work towards industry-recognised qualifications, using online learning, training modules and career planning tools for you to grow with us. We’ll even pay you to do volunteer or community work. As an equal opportunity employer, we’re proud to have created a culture and work environment that values diversity and flexibility – and champions inclusion 
How do I Apply?
 
As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply. 
Our people are our highest priority and we are committed to placing our redeployees in available roles before we review other applicants. 
The Westpac Group has implemented an Entry to Workplace Policy that requires employees and others entering our workplaces to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by relevant dates set out in the policy (subject to applicable medical exemptions). Our employees are required to comply with the policy regardless of whether they are in customer-facing or non-customer-facing roles (as employees in non-customer-facing roles are required to attend the workplace under our Hybrid Working Strategy). Further, the Westpac Group is required to comply with State/Territory issued public health orders/directions which require relevant workers to be vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter workplaces. 
By applying for this role, you acknowledge that you are aware of our Entry to Workplace Policy , and if you secure employment with us, you will be required to comply with the policy.

About QTC

 Queensland Treasury Corporation (QTC) has been recognised as one of Australia’s best places to work, winning multiple ‘Employer of Choice’ awards in recent years for professional development, employee benefits and culture.
 QTC is Queensland’s central financing authority and provides financial, risk management and advisory services for the State. QTC manages the State’s funding program in the global capital markets to deliver sustainable and cost-effective borrowings for the Queensland Government, local governments and other clients.
 QTC protects Queensland’s financial interests by helping to deliver innovative, long-term solutions that contribute to the growth of the Queensland economy. It delivers better financial outcomes by centralising the management of its clients’ borrowings, cash investments, and foreign exchange requirements.

 About the role
 It is the responsibility of the Data & Analytics team at QTC to act as a technical data steward with focus on the provision of financial data for consumption by internal and external clients. You will be involved in the full data life cycle from the operational systems to the reporting layers. You will develop an understanding of data warehousing and ETL processes so that exceptions are resolved in a timely manner. The successful candidate will have the ability to interact with business areas to understand, translate and package data requirements into dashboard and reporting solutions. The role encompasses data collection, data wrangling, data analytics and the implementation of associated new technologies.
 Your skills and experience

 Studying for a tertiary qualification in Finance, Mathematics, Data Science, Computer Science or other relevant discipline
 Some experience using data warehousing and business intelligence tools, preferably the Microsoft Azure Data Platform (Azure SQL, Data Factory, Databricks, Synapse Analytics, DevOps)
 Experience with SQL, R or Python.
 Data modelling and dashboard design skills
 Strong critical thinking and analytical skills
 Strong interpersonal skills, with a proactive and collaborative approach to problem solving
 Interest in working with financial markets data.

 To be considered for this exciting opportunity, please submit your cover letter and CV no later than Monday 5th September 2022.
 Work
 We do work that improves Queensland for generations. We are a leader in finance, creating meaningful solutions with profound outcomes. We set the standard in financial solutions. We address the challenges of today, with results for tomorrow.

 People
 We are an inspired team that come from many diverse backgrounds and skillsets. We believe that curiosity and collaboration are the ultimate tools for problem solving that enable us to support our clients. Our teams are united by trust and have a continual willingness to learn, develop subject matter expertise, and finding ways to help change be implemented

 Culture
 Through connection, candour and clarity, our people are able to bring the best version of themselves to work every day. Our high-performance culture where energised teams collaborate, challenge and find innovative solutions empowers us to learn, grow and develop.

 Benefits
 We are dedicated to investing in your future. At QTC each team member is empowered to ‘invest in you’ and drive their development towards their career ambitions. With the support of our leaders coaching and providing feedback we are committed to enabling the best version of you at QTC. Benefit from professional development programs, flexible work, leadership programs, study support, paid-parental leave, salary packaging and a corporate wellbeing program (including discounts for you and your family to a range of fitness facilities close to home or work).

 ‘Employer of Choice’ and Culture awards
 QTC has been recognised as one of Australia’s best places to work, receiving the ‘Employer of Choice’ award from Human Resources Director (HRD) in 2021 and 2020. QTC also received an Excellence Award at the Australian HR Awards for ‘Employer of Choice’ in 2020. In 2019, QTC received a high-profile award from the world’s foremost culture and leadership experts—The Human Synergistics’s Culture Transformation Achievement Award—for the positive behaviour and attitude of its employees.

Working at Atlassian



 Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company.



 With a sufficient timezone overlap with the team, 
   we're able to hire eligible candidates for this role from any location in Australia and New Zealand. If this sparks your interest, apply today and chat with our friendly Recruitment team further.
  

    As a Product Manager at Atlassian you will report to the Group Product Manager. You will lead our mission to unleash the potential in every team! Join our product team to help craft and drive our vision of an Open DevOps toolchain backed by Jira Software that works seamlessly with tools across the entire software development lifecycle so software teams can discovery, build, and operate great working software in an agile way. You will create valuable, unique product experiences for our customers by leveraging connected data across 1st, 2nd, and 3rd party tools. You are someone who is extremely customer-centric and always starts by understanding their aspirations, needs, and pain points to then translate that into an exciting product vision & strategy that will inspire customers and internal teams. Your work will impact millions of users as you define the foundations for how modern software teams connect, collaborate, and accomplish outstanding things.
  

 More about you


    You love working hard to identify customer problems and build remarkable solutions for technology teams. You have prior success setting clear team goals, making priority decisions, holding yourself and the team accountable, developing a strategy to achieve those goals, and rapidly iterating towards success while keeping customers at the centre.
  

    You communicate clearly to your team, to leaders, to customers, and to partners. You are adept at forming relationships across crafts, products and functional groups to make sure we stay aligned. Previous experience in the fields of SaaS, collaboration tools, or developer tools are a plus.
  



On your first day you will have;


 Previous product management experience, ideally in a fast growing software company with a cloud native architectures or SaaS based business model.
 Early experience leading and launching features/products that meet the needs of customers and the business, ideally bringing a developer focused product to product-market fit.
 Articulated 6-12 month product goals and strategies to internal and external audiences.
 Ability to paint a compelling vision to inspire cross functional teams and senior leaders.
 Ability to prioritise opportunities, balance customers needs with business needs, and clearly communicate the rationale behind decisions.
 Track record of building relationships and influencing without authority at all levels of the organisation in large scale highly collaborative companies across multiple timezones.
 Experience defining and tracking towards key business and usage success metrics.






It's great but not required if you have;


 Computer Science or technical degree and/or have worked directly on an agile team to discover, build, and operate software continuously.
 Experience building products for team collaboration, agile software development, insights and reporting, or the DevOps market.
 A passion and expertise for building data-driven experiences.






More about our team


    The Atlassian DevOps product team builds Atlassian's products for the software development, DevOps and IT markets. We are re-inventing how developers and operations come together to enable our customers' mission critical digital transformations all around the world. Our team is responsible not just for individual products but delivering a unified software development experience across our first party tools and those of our third party partners. The Product Management team is defined by our connection to customers. We empathise with their struggles and are passionate about crafting solutions to understand, validate, and solve their problems. Collaboration is our glue, whether it is working with engineering, design, project management or product marketing. From the smallest details to three year planning and vision, we are the meeting point of business, technology and customer solutions—and we love it every step of the way.
  

    We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians drive our success. To ensure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience, we never discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
  


 Our perks & benefits



 To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more.
  


 About Atlassian



 The world’s best teams work better together with Atlassian. From medicine and space travel, to disaster response and pizza deliveries, Atlassian software products help teams all over the planet. At Atlassian, we're motivated by a common goal: to unleash the potential of every team.
  


 We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians create our success. To ensure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience, we never discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
  


 To learn more about our culture and hiring process, explore our Candidate Resource Hub.

Melbourne/Sydney 

 Energetic, fun, and collaborative team atmosphere 

 Well-established global underwriting agency 

 Flexible work environment with a focus on work/life balance 

 About DUAL 

 Driven by a vision to be the world’s best underwriting business, DUAL has always taken a different approach to our 
industry peers. Since our business was founded in 2004, we have had a strong entrepreneurial spirit that runs through every part of 
our business. We empower our people to develop products, services and processes that deliver consistently for our 
partners. As a company we’re known in the industry as a group dedicated to giving back to the community by partnering 
with charitable groups and actively participating in fundraising events. Whatever you are looking for in a career, we 
want to help you do more. 


Our philosophy is simple: we genuinely put people first and want our people to be the healthiest and happiest they 
can be, at work and at home. We aim to attract and retain the best talent and support them to achieve their aspirations. 
It’s how we grow our business and keep one step ahead of our competitors. 
About the Role 

 Our Operations Team is growing, and we are looking for an experienced Software Engineer to join the team. This role 
provides the opportunity for candidates to work remotely or be based in one of DUAL’s offices in Perth, Melbourne, 
Sydney, Brisbane, or Auckland. As a key part of the team, you will take the initiative to ensure business needs are fully 
understood and solutions developed in response to user requirements. 

 This role is responsible for designing, developing, and delivering updates to our next generation online rating and 
insurance platform WebRater/ IMS. This role is crucial to delivering a modern and easy to user web platform for our 
broker and other customers. 
About You 

 With 5 years’ experience in an in-house development team, you will be confident in the development and ongoing 
modifications for internal systems. You will have the confidence to communicate clearly and concisely across all levels 
of the business both written and verbally and articulate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. 

 Our ideal candidate will have the following technical experience: 



Experience across C#, .NET, Angular 8 or later
Experience with modern web technologies• Experience with Azure and Azure Devops in an Enterprise environment highly desirable
High level problem-solving skills with the ability to ‘think outside of the box’, and passion for innovation and
 new technology 


Experience working in small dynamic distributed team
Experience with SDLC and source code management (preferred)
Bachelor of Science in Computing Science, or similar (preferred)
 As the manager for this team resides internationally, this role requires the ability to work independently and with 
minimal direction at times. 
Salary and Benefits 

 At DUAL we value work/life balance, health and wellbeing, family and giving back, which is why our benefits are 
reflective of this. We provide employees with a competitive salary and benefits, which will be flexible and dependent 
on the successful candidate’s individual skills and experience. 
How to Apply 

 Are you the right fit for this role and the DUAL Team? Tell us why in a short paragraph that you share along with your 
Resume to our HR Team. 
Find out more 

 To find out more about DUAL Australia including who we are, what we’re up to and what we’re about, head to the DUAL 
Australia website or visit us on our LinkedIn page. 
EEO Statement 

 Help us think differently. As a business we’re on a journey to build an inclusive workplace where our people feel 
welcome to bring their whole and true self to work, where differences are accepted and where our words and actions 
are inclusive. Together we are learning, sharing stories, and achieving change.

Headquartered in Atlanta GA, Logility is a leading provider of collaborative supply chain optimization and advanced retail planning solutions that help small, medium, large, and Fortune 500 companies realize substantial bottom-line results in record time. GitHub helps companies and organizations succeed by allowing them to build better software together. We're looking for Customer Success Managers to develop positive customer relationships and continue to grow GitHub’s business. We care about customer success and customer outcomes, and we're extremely passionate about the quality of our work. The ideal candidate will have the aptitude to deepen our customer relationships, be proactive with addressing issues and concerns, and have a passion for working with others.
 Responsibilities In close partnership with GitHub sales professionals, CSMs have a number of key responsibilities to improve our product offering and our customer relationships. The CSM will be expected to help customers achieve their business outcomes related to topics such as software development lifecycle, DevOps, InnerSource, code analysis and security, product strategy and enablement. The role involves three essential components:

Driving Adoption: Many of our customers begin with a set of strategic projects that grow into sizable partnerships. Working with GitHub Sales Professionals, the CSM will: 
   
Develop strategies to expand engagement and enable adoption
Build relationships with the key stakeholders & decision makers
Build initiatives with customers to expand product awareness and identify new opportunities for growth.
Distill best practices across client base and deliver insights and advice based on those practices
Support the expansion and renewal opportunities.

Program Management: Customers typically have complex challenges that require focused management of programs that involve customer and GitHub team members working in partnership together. Working cross-functionally with Professional Services, Support, Product, Sales and Solution Engineering the CSM will: 
   
Conduct regular customer “health check” meetings
Identify and manage risks or issues for customer initiatives
Act as the coordinator or internal GitHub resources for customer initiatives
Conduct regular business reviews to provide customer and GitHub stakeholders with status, insights and strategic planning

Voice of the Customer: CSMs will be expected to champion the voice of the customer internally at GitHub. In addition to providing an authoritative view of customer health, Working closely with Product, Marketing, Support and Sales the CSM will: 
   
Track customer health metrics
Support executive alignment and engagement with customers
Connect customer feedback to Product & Marketing
Develop customer superfans to help evangelize within customer organizations and externally with other GitHub customers.
 

Qualifications:

5-7 years program management, technical account management, or professional services consulting experience that includes customer-facing responsibilities
Experience helping customers with software development practices, DevOps, CI/CD, or open source development practices
Passion for continually improving the customer experience
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Experience with executive stakeholder management and a strong executive presence
Ability to travel approximately 25% when it is safe to do so

Essential Qualifications:

Comfortable working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Experience working in the software development domain
Knowledge or experience in DevOps, DevSecOps deployments or CI/CD tools
Collaborative and team-focused, with a willingness to take initiative
Self-directed and resourceful
Preferred: Experience working in the software development application software security or CI/CD domains
Preferred: Experience guiding enterprise organizations through transformational change in technical domains.


Location: In this role, you can work remotely from anywhere in Australia.
 #LI-Remote


Who We Are:
 GitHub is the developer company. We make it easier for developers to be developers: to work together, to solve challenging problems, and to create the world’s most important technologies. We foster a collaborative community that can come together—as individuals and in teams—to create the future of software and make a difference in the world.
 Leadership Principles:
 Customer Obsessed - Trust by Default - Ship to Learn - Own the Outcome - Growth Mindset - Global Product, Global Team - Anything is Possible - Practice Kindness
 Why You Should Join:
 At GitHub, we constantly strive to create an environment that allows our employees (Hubbers) to do the best work of their lives. We've designed one of the coolest workspaces in San Francisco (HQ), where many Hubbers work, snack, and create daily. The rest of our Hubbers work remotely around the globe. Check out an updated list of where we can hire here: https://github.com/about/careers/remote
 We are also committed to keeping Hubbers healthy, motivated, focused and creative. We've designed our top-notch benefits program with these goals in mind. In a nutshell, we've built a place where we truly love working, we think you will too.
 GitHub is made up of people from a wide variety of backgrounds and lifestyles. We embrace diversity and invite applications from people of all walks of life. We don't discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, disability, pregnancy status, veteran status, or any other differences. Also, if you have a disability, please let us know if there's any way we can make the interview process better for you; we're happy to accommodate!
 Please note that benefits vary by country. If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to ask your Talent Partner.

Job Title:
   Online Engineer - Sledgehammer Games
  

    Requisition ID:
   R017379
  

    Job Description:
  
 Your Platform 

Sledgehammer Games is situated in the San Francisco Bay Area; Melbourne, Australia; Toronto, Canada; and Guildford, UK. Across our four locations, we strive to be the most inclusive and supportive game studio we can be. We are extremely passionate about working together to make incredible AAA games for our players to enjoy and connect with.

 We’re the studio behind Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare 3, Call of Duty®: Advanced Warfare, Call of Duty®: WWII, and Call of Duty®: Vanguard. With world-class audio, design, engineering, and art teams, we’ve been able to achieve some of the highest-quality game execution of any studio in the industry.

 The strength of our team makes us not only excellent at what we do, but also how we do it. We firmly believe in supporting our talented employees to be the best they can be. Here at Sledgehammer Games, everyone is a game maker. We think it’s important to be constantly evolving, innovating, and taking risks – which are some of the most rewarding aspects of game development. We love what we do and work hard to make sure that each new game we make is even better than the last. Creativity is key, and we’re looking for talented game developers for our exciting next project.

 Sledgehammer Games is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.sledgehammergames.com or search for Sledgehammer Games on your favorite social media platform. Want to hear what it’s like at the studio directly from current employees? Check out our #LifeatSHG developer profiles: https://youtu.be/12DUBszg-w


 Your Mission


 As an Online Engineer you will build the features that connect our users. You will work with game designers and gameplay engineers to prototype, design, implement, and optimise the transmission and storage of the data that drives our games.

 Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities:

 Build the server-side components of in-game features
 Build and maintain client libraries that expose online features to gameplay and UI engineers
 Optimise multiplayer netcode and data payloads
 Collaborate with game designers and DevOps engineers to determine efficient solutions
 Document technical designs and instructions
 Instrument and analyse telemetry during development and LiveOps timeframes



 Player Profile


 Minimum Requirements:

 Bachelor's degree or relevant field
 3+ years of proven experience
 Solid C/C++ skills
 Familiar with Python
 Proficient with debugging real-time applications
 Understanding of network, multi-threaded and concurrent programming
 Experience maintaining security of server endpoints and systems
 Collaborates and communicates across teams
 History working with Windows development and run-time environments
 Passion for developing high quality games
 Basic experience with databases



    Extra Points:
  

 Shipped 1-2 games
 Developed on Microsoft, Sony, and/or Steam platforms
 Experience with large telemetry systems
 History working with Linux development and run-time environments



 Our World 


Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet!

 Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional, and financial wellbeing for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered!

 Sledgehammer Games is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

 The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners

Flexible work options, competitive salary with generous leave benefits
We invest time in our people and help them chart their own career trajectory
We prioritise respect for each other, our customers, communities & stakeholders

 Based in 
 Melbourne, the 
 Senior DevOps Software Engineer is responsible for delivering software solutions that provide the capability to Shell Energy to implement its strategic plans as well as to flex to meet its future business goals.
 
 This role requires a DevOps Software Engineer and Agilist with skills and experience to work with several technologies and architectural approaches to uplift Shell Energy’s technical capability and remediate technical debt. The Senior Software Engineer will work collaboratively within an Agile Squad to create, support, and enhance products and areas of functionality it owns. The cradle to grave solution approach embraces our DevOps model and is delivered in alignment with our values and culture.
 
 To be successful in this role, in addition to your excellent technical capabilities, you will help shape your squad’s way of working by fostering and applying modern engineering practices to solve problems and agile principles to deliver valuable business outcomes. You will exemplify self-organising behaviours, a continuous improvement mindset and an inclusive one-team culture. You will champion Cloud adoption, Test Automation, CI/CD, Site Reliability Engineering, and new Application Architectures (specifically Microservice Architectures and Event Driven Application Architectures) in your squad. You will be supported by the Delivery lead, Engineering Leads, Architecture, IT Enablement and QA teams.
 
 You will have the ability to learn and apply modern engineering practices to solve problems and agile principles to deliver incremental, valuable business outcomes. You will bring an inquisitive, continuous improvement mindset that actively supports Cloud adoption, Test Automation, CI/CD, Site Reliability Engineering, and new Application Architectures (specifically Microservice Architectures and Event Driven Application Architectures) in your squad. You will be supported by the Technical Lead in your squad and the Architecture and Engagement team.
 

Qualifications & Licenses


Bachelor’s degree in IT, Software Engineering, Software Development or related field;
In the absence of tertiary qualifications, demonstrated industry experience will be required;
DevOps certifications are desirable;
AWS certified (minimum Developer – Associate) or be progressing toward certification;
Formal Agile or DevOps qualifications or certifications will be well regarded.

Why join us?

 At Shell Energy we work in a culture of care and curiosity, and encourage innovation and collaboration. We support flexible working and embrace a diverse and inclusive environment, with people who are passionate about disrupting the industry and simplifying energy for our customers. Guided by our three core values – respect, integrity and honesty – we focus relentlessly on delivering outstanding service and cutting-edge solutions to our customers. We do this by employing the best people in the business, and empowering them to get on and do what they do best.
 

About Shell Energy

 Shell Energy is Shell’s renewables and energy solutions business in Australia, helping its customers to decarbonise and reduce their environmental footprint.
 
 Shell Energy delivers business energy solutions and innovation across a portfolio of electricity, gas, environmental products and energy productivity for commercial and industrial customers, while our residential energy retailing business Powershop, acquired in 2022, serves more than 185,000 households and small business customers in Australia.
 
 As the second largest electricity provider to commercial and industrial businesses in Australia, Shell Energy offers integrated solutions and market-leading customer satisfaction, built on industry expertise and personalised relationships. The company’s generation assets include 662 megawatts of gas-fired peaking power stations in Western Australia and Queensland, supporting the transition to renewables, and the 120 megawatt Gangarri solar energy development in Queensland.
 
 Shell Energy Australia Pty Ltd and its subsidiaries trade as Shell Energy, while Powershop Australia Pty Ltd trades as Powershop. Further information about Shell Energy and our operations can be found on our website. https://shellenergy.com.au
 

Recruitment Agencies please note: this recruitment assignment is being managed directly by the Shell Energy Human Resources team. We will reach out to our preferred agency partners if required. Your respect for this process is appreciated.

Backed by an ambitious team, the latest technology, first-class customer service and a state of the art test facility, Carma makes buying pre-loved cars a seamless, hassle-free experience. Embrace the chance to be part of a fast-growing business right from the start.
  


 About the Role:


    Reporting to the QA Manager, we are looking for an experienced Quality Engineer to join our Technology team to drive excellence and quality across all of our platforms. This role will be responsible for;
  



Responsibilities


 Collaborating with a number of internal teams and external partners to develop in depth user stories, including user acceptance and quality assurance criteria.
 Identifying opportunities for points of automation across our platforms, and create scripts to deliver these capabilities.
 Reviewing current and create additional testing frameworks across a number of platforms, as well as being involved in manual testing where automation cannot support.
 Working with different business units in an agile lifecycle to drive continuous improvement and successful deployments of platforms and further integrations.
 Taking the initiative upon yourself to research Carma’s current testing environment to find opportunities for improvement within our tools and methodologies. 






About you 


Minimum of 3 years experience in testing web based applications.
 Strong experience in writing automation scripts, exposure to Cypress, Playwright, Jest or K6 would be advantageous.

At GenesisCare we want to hear from people who are as passionate as we are about innovation and working together to drive better life outcomes for patients around the world.
 


   Do you want to work on products that improve the world we live in? If you join GenesisCare’s Digital Solutions team you can not only work on a modern tech stack, but you also get to work on a suite of products that is helping improve the standard of care that cancer patients receive, and you get to join a dynamic, fun team of genuinely good humans.
 


   About the position:
   We are searching for a mid level software engineer with full stack or front end experience, to join one of our three teams building modern Single Page Apps for Doctors, Nurses and Patients.
 


   Our front-end is built using React with Hooks, apollo with graphQL, the backend is build using the Python Django framework. We maintain code quality with Jest + Enzyme for unit testing, Cypress for automation testing and Eslint to follow TypeScript standards
 


   About you:
 

   You will be someone who can think outside the box, challenges the status quo, has high energy levels and is someone that wants to work in a dynamic, fun, fast paced environment.
 

   With a passion for building web applications that users love, you are looking for an environment where you can learn and grow in a fun, supportive team.
 

   You are either a full stack engineer with experience of SPA’s or a front end engineer where your framework of choice is React.
 


   Skills and Experience for success:
 

 4+ years experience working in software development in particular web applications
 3+ years of Python (Django) or React
 Experience with GraphQL frameworks such as Apollo or Relay is a bonus
 Experience with build tools such as Docker
 Demonstrated experience creating and maintaining automation tests like cypress, jest or pyunit



   About Us:
 

   The Digital Solutions team at GenesisCare has a vision to deliver evidence-based care around the world using a common platform to improve patient experience and life outcomes. We do this by building products for Patients, Doctors, Nurses & Radiation Therapists. Our products are built to provide intelligent automated workflows to drive consistency across the treatment journey, we leverage Machine Learning to improve decision support for staff, ultimately with the goal of improving patient’s lives.
 


   Technologies we use:
 

 Front-end: Webpack, TypeScript, React, Apollo, GraphQL, SCSS, Styled Components, Jest, Cypress
 Backend: Python Django, Graphene, Redis, Redis Streams, Celery, Fast API etc.
 Hosting/Ops: AWS, Docker, Terraform, DataDog, Cloud Watch, Sentry, Elastic Cache, Redash



   How we work:
 

 Teams: Each product engineering team consists of 3-5 engineers, a PO and either a BA or a Designer and Clinical Subject Matter expert. Teams are cross-functional, self-organised and most use a flavour of Scrum with a 2-week sprint.
 Guilds: Guilds are a place to share knowledge and experiences across tech, product and clinical areas. We have a weekly tech guild/tech reading club and a quarterly clinical guild where we hear from Doctors, Nurses and Patients that use our applications.
 Test focused: We like to test the code we build, and we have a continuous integration infrastructure in place that runs our tests on every push.
 DevOps mindset: We are cloud first, and everything outside local dev is hosted in AWS. Each team is responsible for deployments and monitoring of their own services. All work is managed through GitHub and Jira.
 Privacy and data security: we take our patients’ right to privacy seriously, and are continuously enhancing our practices to achieve this, while supporting our products’ deployments in multiple regions, including the EU and US.
 Remote First: We have distributed teams across the UK, USA and Australia. We have a remote first principle and have evolved our team ways of working during the last few years of remote work. Note, if you are Sydney based, our team in Sydney do get together once a week at our head office for some good old-fashioned face to face time.



   GenesisCare is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Working at Atlassian



 Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company.



 With a sufficient timezone overlap with the team, we’re able to hire eligible candidates for this role from any location in Australia and New Zealand. If this sparks your interest, apply today and chat with our friendly Recruitment team further.



 Atlassian is one of the fastest-growing software companies in the world, with millions of users across our products (Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, Trello, and Statuspage, to name a few.)
  


 Have you ever found yourself rewriting onboarding tours, in-app tips, or product tutorials in your head? If you can explain complex features within tiny amounts of product real estate and communicate value in compelling, clear, and effective help articles, come join Atlassian's Content Design team!
  


 We’re hiring a Content Designer to join our Design Team, which will be someone who has the ability to drive strategic content initiatives to help us mature our solutions for our customers as well as contribute to the Atlassian content design craft.
  


 In other words, this isn’t a traditional technical writing or UX writing role.
  



As part of the Atlassian Design team, you will:


 Refine and drive content strategy, and apply the Atlassian voice and tone in a way that drives engagement with the product portfolios. This could be across Jira Software, Confluence, Trello, Bitbucket, Statuspage, Compass, to name a few.
 Work closely with the design, PM, marketing, and training teams to understand customer insights, the purpose of features, and how best to explain them to the right audience.
 Deliver effective UX writing and longer form explanatory content (documentation, how-to articles, tutorials, etc.) for the product portfolio on time and with quality against an agile and frequent product release schedule.








 When you join the team, you’d be expected to have:


 Excellent writing skills
 A love for user content and UX (both long-form content and microcopy)
 Experience working with product managers, engineers, designers, marketing, and support
 A proven track record of working in and managing projects in an agile, fast-paced environment
 An understanding of how content drives business objectives
 Experience using design thinking and design processes (critique, user journeys, personas) to improve or validate your work

 The Opportunity


 The SKA Observatory (SKAO) is coordinating a global effort to build the largest science facility on the planet. This next-generation radio-astronomy observatory will transform our understanding of the Universe and deliver benefits to society through global collaboration and innovation.
SKAO is one observatory with two telescopes: SKA-Low in Western Australia and SKA-Mid in South Africa, with the global headquarters at Jodrell Bank, UK. The SKAO is an intergovernmental organisation composed of member states from four continents, with organisations from 16 countries in total currently participating in the project.



Build your career as part of an international mega-science project
Innovative and collaborative workplace with fantastic flexibility
Join CSIRO - Australia's premier research organisation


 
The Senior Controls Software Engineer – SKA-Low, provides technical leadership to the team supporting the development and operations of the control software of the SKA-Low telescope. The position works alongside the SKAO’s Controls Architect, and the teams around the world developing the control and monitoring software in the telescope’s construction phase.




 Your duties will include:



Work with the stakeholders to continually refine control system requirements for the SKA telescopes to ensure they meet the system requirements in an appropriate and cost-effective manner.
Take part in the activities of the Observation Monitoring and Control Agile Release Train (OMC ART) as required by the SKA Project SAFe implementation and its evolution through construction and operations.
Support the software development, deployment, maintenance and operations activities of the telescope and observatory control systems with particular attention to DevOps practices. Initially, this may involve working on, and/or supporting, one of the Construction development teams.
Be an integral member of an international software team.
Be a technical leader for the local controls engineering team.


 
Location: Perth, Western Australia
Salary: AU$117k - AU$138k pa plus up to 15.4% superannuation
Tenure: Indefinite
Reference: 87792




 To be considered you will need:


 Essential:

Have excellent skills in C++ and/or Python software development in a GNU/Linux environment. The candidate is encouraged to provide evidence in the form of publicly available code where possible.
Understand the software development life cycle, based on common code versioning tools like Git, with particular attention to quality aspects, testing and configuration management.
Have excellent communication and influencing skills with distributed, highly specialised project teams and stakeholders, across international and diverse cultural backgrounds.
Experience in technical and/or team leadership positions, or evidence of potential to fulfill such leadership positions, promoting diversity and developing an inclusive, high-performing culture.
Demonstrate technical expertise in at least one of the following systems: 
      
The Tango Control system, or
A comparable system that can be demonstrated to have similar characteristics.
 


Desirable:

Demonstrate understanding and willingness to work based on lean/agile principles adopting DevOps practices.
Have a working knowledge of virtualisation and containerisation technologies.
Have experience in contributing to large open-source projects.
Demonstrate interest in astronomy and understanding of the challenges of controlling telescopes similar to SKA. 

For full details about this role please review the Position Description




 Eligibility


 Appointment to this role is subject to provision of a national police check and may be subject to other security/medical/character requirements.
To enter a CSIRO site, CSIRO will require you to show proof of vaccination against COVID-19 (or show a valid medical exemption from vaccination). If you are unable to meet this requirement, then you must return a negative result on a Rapid Antigen Test (within 48 hours prior to attending site) and wear a face mask whilst on the CSIRO site. The Team


 In Data Science we work collaboratively with teams across the organisation to create and evolve end to end solutions that have Data Science at their core. We give you a world of potential
Computershare has a great opportunity to join our Digital Foundry department as a Senior DevOps Engineer. The Digital Foundry team combines a dedicated team of technology specialists that exploit and industrialise new technology for innovation and product launch here at Computershare. The team works across all of Computershare’s lines of business to help them deliver value to their customers/clients – making every project (a.k.a Mission) vastly different!
The team currently builds multi-channel, multi-market, event-driven architectures that are cloud (Azure) first. We’ve been using a mix of low-code (OutSystems) and pro-code (C# / React) to experiment and deliver as quickly (and securely!) as possible. 
This is a remote role open to applicants located across Australia, offering you flexibility to harmonise both work and life.


A role you will love
You will report to the Cloud & QE Manager and will support the Delivery Teams to ensure they have the best environments in which they can work in. Take part in helping drive DevOps practices within the Digital Foundry and the wider Computershare community, working to manage our builds, pipelines, compute, and storage.
Some of the other key day to day activities:

Support the infrastructure requirements of the technologists in the Digital Foundry team
Support systems quickly so they can be scaled fast and be easily observable
Work as a part of the Cloud Enablement Teamto build pipelines and environments that support the broader Digital Foundry group
Support the quick and repeatable rollout of infrastructure and applications for the group
Ensure we use the right tools and infrastructure for the right job
Work closely with the Digital Foundry’s Delivery Teams, Platform and Technical specialists to ensure we meet the Mission requirements while ensuring that it will scale for the Business Unit if the Mission is successful and is rapidly rolled out
Be actively engaged with the Regional / Business Unit Infrastructure and Network teams to ensure you understand their pain points, current limitations and what their future direction is
Ensure the long-term success of the Mission output for the Business
Look for better ways to do things and continuously improve
Attend conferences, in house training and share your learnings with the team and encourage others to do the same
Contribute to the direction of DevOps within the Digital Foundry and the Computershare enterprise. Mentor junior staff within the group.


 
What will you bring to the role?
We are looking for a talented and passionate Senior Software Engineer ideally with some experience in DevOps or some exposure to key CI/CD tools. You have a true passion for qualities in all stages of software development and for automation, scripting.
Key essential skills required include:



2+ years experience working in the DevOps space (or adjacent to it)
4+ years in Software Engineering broadly
Extensive experience working in the DevOps space (or adjacent to it)
Experience developing in a modern software language C#/Java/Ruby etc
Experience writing SQL / Stored procedures
Experience with a scripting language (preferably PowerShell)
Experience working with build pipeline tools (TFS / TeamCity / Octopus / Azure DevOps etc)
Strong problem solving, analytical thinking and teamwork skills
Passionate about assisting the team to build quality, scalable solutions
Ability to effectively manage yourself through ambiguity and change
Continuous improvement and a learning mindset
Tertiary qualifications in Technology or similar/relevant certifications

Desired skills (but not essential)

Knowledge of ARM templates or other Infrastructure as Code tools (Terraform, Pulumi)
Experience with Azure DevOps pipelines / yaml
Knowledge of the broader 'Azure' stack
Knowledge/use of Serverless
APIS / SwaggerHub or equivalent
Networking Architecture
Knowledge / experience with containers (Docker etc)

Software Engineer (Python)

What the role is about...
 This is an opportunity to join a team where ideas are shared openly between software engineers, quantitative traders and researchers. Your contribution will make a big difference to the future success of the team. As such, we expect people to be willing to contribute in areas beyond their immediate responsibilities.


 The team's responsibilities include real time, live trading, historical backtesting, data processing pipelines and research. The codebase is mainly python but also includes some fundamental components that are written in C++. It runs on both Linux and Windows systems.


 The areas you will work on will include market connectivity, monitoring tools, pre and post-trade analytics, market data, backtest/live reconciliations, signal implementation and performance reports. There is also ample opportunity to improve operational procedures and tools.


 Successful candidates must also have a pragmatic approach with solid technical skills.


 What your main responsibilities will be...

Designing, building and maintaining trading system components.
Monitoring, support and maintenance of the existing systems and infrastructure.
Apply modern devops paradigms to enhance operational capabilities.
Improving the system redundancy.
Document internal operational procedures.
Contribute to the continuous refinement of the desk systems.
Be prepared to be part of the overnight support rotation.



 To be successful in this role, these are the essential experiences & skills you need…

B.Sc. Computer Science or other engineering disciplines.
2+ years in Python software development on Linux & Windows in a trading environment.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, interested in finance and trading.
Good design skills.
Good understanding of data structures.
Experience with real time, Linux systems.
Attention to detail.
Proactive approach and willing to take ownership of problems.



 If you also had these skills, it would be an added bonus…

Experience with C++.
Experience with front-end web development.
Experience building real time trading systems.
Experience integrating front and back office trading systems.
Experience working with docker, AWS, Alerta, Airflow, Influx DB and Grafana.
Experience with TT, CME, ICE, FX Spot Stream, Reuters and BPIPE.
Experience with Windows.
